proven/al : (a.) Of or pertaining to Provence or its inhabitants. | : (n.) A native or inhabitant of Provence in France. | : (n.) The Provencal language. See Langue d'oc.
permissively : (adv.) In a permissive manner.
platonizer : (n.) One who Platonizes.
plangent : (a.) Beating; dashing, as a wave.
pactitious : (a.) Setted by a pact, or agreement.
perquisited : (a.) Supplied with perquisites.
phlogistication : (n.) The act or process of combining with phlogiston.
predigestion : (n.) Digestion too soon performed; hasty digestion. | : (n.) Artificial digestion of food for use in illness or impaired digestion.
pronotum : (n.) The dorsal plate of the prothorax in insects. See Illust. of Coleoptera.
peccadillo : (n.) A slight trespass or offense; a petty crime or fault.
prigging : (p. pr. & vb. n.) of Prig
predicant : (a.) Predicating; affirming; declaring; proclaiming; hence; preaching. | : (n.) One who predicates, affirms, or proclaims; specifically, a preaching friar; a Dominican.
perissad : (a.) Odd; not even; -- said of elementary substances and of radicals whose valence is not divisible by two without a remainder. Contrasted with artiad.
peritomous : (a.) Cleaving in more directions than one, parallel to the axis.
pandect : (n.) A treatise which comprehends the whole of any science. | : (n.) The digest, or abridgment, in fifty books, of the decisions, writings, and opinions of the old Roman jurists, made in the sixth century by direction of the emperor Justinian, and forming the leading compilation of the Roman civil law.
parapetalous : (a.) Growing by the side of a petal, as a stamen.
pseudotetramera : (n. pl.) A division of beetles having the fifth tarsal joint minute and obscure, so that there appear to be but four joints.
ploughfoot : (n.) An adjustable staff formerly attached to the plow beam to determine the depth of the furrow.
parricidious : (a.) Parricidal.
perichete : (n.) Same as Perichaeth.
prosecutable : (a.) Capable of being prosecuted; liable to prosecution.
peshito : (n.) Alt. of Peshitto
palmcrist : (n.) The palma Christi. (Jonah iv. 6, margin, and Douay version, note.)
plasmid : (n.) A piece of DNA, usually circular, functioning as part of the genetic material of a cell, not integrated with the chromosome and replicating independently of the chromosome, but transferred, like the chromosome, to subsequent generations. In bacteria, plasmids often carry the genes for antibiotic resistance; they are exploited in genetic engineering as the vehicles for introduction of extraneous DNA into cells, to alter the genetic makeup of the cell. The cells thus altered may produce desirable proteins which are extracted and used; in the case of genetically altered plant cells, the altered cells may grow into complete plants with changed properties, as for example, increased resistance to disease.
plasmic : (a.) Of, pertaining to, or connected with, plasma; plasmatic.
poorliness : (n.) The quality or state of being poorly; ill health.
pinnage : (n.) Poundage of cattle. See Pound.
pandered : (imp. & p. p.) of Pander
proleptical : (a.) Of or pertaining to prolepsis; anticipative. | : (a.) Previous; antecedent. | : (a.) Anticipating the usual time; -- applied to a periodical disease whose paroxysms return at an earlier hour at every repetition.
pushpin : (n.) A child's game played with pins.
passioned : (imp. & p. p.) of Passion
percolator : (n.) One who, or that which, filters.
palpitation : (n.) A rapid pulsation; a throbbing; esp., an abnormal, rapid beating of the heart as when excited by violent exertion, strong emotion, or by disease.
politician : (n.) One versed or experienced in the science of government; one devoted to politics; a statesman. | : (n.) One primarily devoted to his own advancement in public office, or to the success of a political party; -- used in a depreciatory sense; one addicted or attached to politics as managed by parties (see Politics, 2); a schemer; an intriguer; as, a mere politician. | : (a.) Cunning; using artifice; politic; artful.
predella : (n.) The step, or raised secondary part, of an altar; a superaltar; hence, in Italian painting, a band or frieze of several pictures running along the front of a superaltar, or forming a border or frame at the foot of an altarpiece.
proportionating : (p. pr. & vb. n.) of Proportionate
pterygopodia : (pl. ) of Pterygopodium
proportionably : (adv.) Proportionally.
philtered : (imp. & p. p.) of Philter
progue : (v. i.) To prog. | : (n.) A sharp point; a goad. | : (v. t. ) To prick; to goad.
polynia : (n.) The open sea supposed to surround the north pole.
pandean : (a.) Of or relating to the god Pan.
plasmin : (n.) A proteid body, separated by some physiologists from blood plasma. It is probably identical with fibrinogen.
pluralization : (n.) The act of pluralizing.
pranked : (imp. & p. p.) of Prank
pathopoela : (n.) A speech, or figure of speech, designed to move the passion.
paramagnetic : (a.) Magnetic, as opposed to diamagnetic. | : (n.) A paramagnetic substance.
pedipalpous : (a.) Pertaining to, or resembling, the pedipalps.
paleotherian : (a.) Of or pertaining to Paleotherium.
puritanically : (adv.) In a puritanical manner.

partitive : (a.) Denoting a part; as, a partitive genitive. | : (n.) A word expressing partition, or denoting a part.
picine : (a.) Of or pertaining to the woodpeckers (Pici), or to the Piciformes.
polliwog : (n.) A tadpole; -- called also purwiggy and porwigle.
preconcerting : (p. pr. & vb. n.) of Preconcert
proface : (interj.) Much good may it do you! -- a familiar salutation or welcome.
pregravate : (v. t.) To bear down; to depress.
profiting : (p. pr. & vb. n.) of Profit | : (n.) Gain; advantage; profit.
progne : (n.) A swallow. | : (n.) A genus of swallows including the purple martin. See Martin. | : (n.) An American butterfly (Polygonia, / Vanessa, Progne). It is orange and black above, grayish beneath, with an L-shaped silver mark on the hind wings. Called also gray comma.
pugnacious : (a.) Disposed to fight; inclined to fighting; quarrelsome; fighting.
porticos : (pl. ) of Portico
preadamic : (a.) Prior to Adam.
pothered : (imp. & p. p.) of Pother
prelatess : (n.) A woman who is a prelate; the wife of a prelate.
polyadelphia : (n. pl.) A Linnaean class of plants having stamens united in three or more bodies or bundles by the filaments.
proportionment : (n.) The act or process of dividing out proportionally.
porphyrite : (n.) A rock with a porphyritic structure; as, augite porphyrite.
premises : (pl. ) of Premise
proportionable : (a.) Capable of being proportioned, or made proportional; also, proportional; proportionate.
pyral : (a.) Of or pertaining to a pyre.
pharyngal : (a.) Pharyngeal.
pichiciago : (n.) A small, burrowing, South American edentate (Chlamyphorus truncatus), allied to the armadillos. The shell is attached only along the back.
preliminary : (a.) Introductory; previous; preceding the main discourse or business; prefatory; as, preliminary observations to a discourse or book; preliminary articles to a treaty; preliminary measures; preliminary examinations. | : (n.) That which precedes the main discourse, work, design, or business; something introductory or preparatory; as, the preliminaries to a negotiation or duel; to take one's preliminaries the year before entering college.
pachycarpous : (a.) Having the pericarp thick.
passional : (a.) Of or pertaining to passion or the passions; exciting, influenced by, or ministering to, the passions. | : (n.) A passionary.
ploughhead : (n.) The clevis or draught iron of a plow.
perisomata : (pl. ) of Perisoma
phyllophagous : (a.) Substituting on leaves; leaf-eating.
panicum : (n.) A genus of grasses, including several hundred species, some of which are valuable; panic grass.
pectinibranch : (n.) One of the Pectinibranchiata. Also used adjectively.
pinniform : (a.) Shaped like a fin or feather.
parkeria : (n.) A genus of large arenaceous fossil Foraminifera found in the Cretaceous rocks. The species are globular, or nearly so, and are of all sizes up to that of a tennis ball.
priceless : (a.) Too valuable to admit of being appraised; of inestimable worth; invaluable. | : (a.) Of no value; worthless.
pendular : (a.) Pendulous.
perineorrhaphy : (n.) The operation of sewing up a ruptured perineum.
providence : (n.) The act of providing or preparing for future use or application; a making ready; preparation. | : (n.) Foresight; care; especially, the foresight and care which God manifests for his creatures; hence, God himself, regarded as exercising a constant wise prescience. | : (n.) A manifestation of the care and superintendence which God exercises over his creatures; an event ordained by divine direction. | : (n.) Prudence in the management of one's concerns; economy; frugality.
pterylography : (n.) The study or description of the arrangement of feathers, or of the pterylae, of birds.
pyruvic : (a.) Pertaining to, or designating, an acid (called also pyroracemic acid) obtained, as a liquid having a pungent odor, by the distillation of racemic acid.
pining : (p. pr. & vb. n.) of Pine | : (a.) Languishing; drooping; wasting away, as with longing. | : (a.) Wasting; consuming.
papistic : (a.) Alt. of Papistical
pycnite : (n.) A massive subcolumnar variety of topaz.
pyruvil : (n.) A complex nitrogenous compound obtained by heating together pyruvic acid and urea.
percipiency : (n.) The faculty, act or power of perceiving; perception.
particularizing : (p. pr. & vb. n.) of Particularize
participially : (adv.) In the sense or manner of a participle.
preventively : (adv.) In a preventive manner.
paramountly : (adv.) In a paramount manner.
priggish : (a.) Like a prig; conceited; pragmatical.
portraying : (p. pr. & vb. n.) of Portray
pinion : (n.) A moth of the genus Lithophane, as L. antennata, whose larva bores large holes in young peaches and apples. | : (n.) A feather; a quill. | : (n.) A wing, literal or figurative. | : (n.) The joint of bird's wing most remote from the body. | : (n.) A fetter for the arm. | : (n.) A cogwheel with a small number of teeth, or leaves, adapted to engage with a larger wheel, or rack (see Rack); esp., such a wheel having its leaves formed of the substance of the arbor or spindle which is its axis. | : (v. t.) To bind or confine the wings of; to confine by binding the wings. | : (v. t.) To disable by cutting off the pinion joint. | : (v. t.) To disable or restrain, as a person, by binding the arms, esp. by binding the arms to the body. | : (v. t.) Hence, generally, to confine; to bind; to tie up.
pipemouth : (n.) Any fish of the genus Fistularia; -- called also tobacco pipefish. See Fistularia.
poulter : (n.) A poulterer.
puppies : (pl. ) of Puppy
priggism : (n.) The quality or state of being priggish; the manners of a prig. | : (n.) Roguery; thievery.
pillager : (n.) One who pillages.
pardonableness : (n.) The quality or state of being pardonable; as, the pardonableness of sin.
poinsettia : (n.) A Mexican shrub (Euphorbia pulcherrima) with very large and conspicuous vermilion bracts below the yellowish flowers.
petering : (p. pr. & vb. n.) of Peter
phalaenid : (n.) Any moth of the family Phalaenidae, of which the cankerworms are examples; a geometrid.

pyramoid : (n.) See Pyramidoid.
percipience : (n.) Alt. of Percipiency

prevailed : (imp. & p. p.) of Prevail
paraboliform : (a.) Resembling a parabola in form.
prensation : (n.) The act of seizing with violence.
pouch : (n.) A small bag; usually, a leathern bag; as, a pouch for money; a shot pouch; a mail pouch, etc. | : (n.) That which is shaped like, or used as, a pouch | : (n.) A protuberant belly; a paunch; -- so called in ridicule. | : (n.) A sac or bag for carrying food or young; as, the cheek pouches of certain rodents, and the pouch of marsupials. | : (n.) A cyst or sac containing fluid. | : (n.) A silicle, or short pod, as of the shepherd's purse. | : (n.) A bulkhead in the hold of a vessel, to prevent grain, etc., from shifting. | : (v. t.) To put or take into a pouch. | : (v. t.) To swallow; -- said of fowls. | : (v. t.) To pout. | : (v. t.) To pocket; to put up with.
placoid : (a.) Platelike; having irregular, platelike, bony scales, often bearing spines; pertaining to the placoids. | : (n.) Any fish having placoid scales, as the sharks. | : (n.) One of the Placoides.
periscian : (a.) Having the shadow moving all around.
psoric : (a.) Of or pertaining to psora.
padelion : (n.) A plant with pedately lobed leaves; the lady's mantle.
persevered : (imp. & p. p.) of Persevere
portcullised : (imp. & p. p.) of Portcullis
put-off : (n.) A shift for evasion or delay; an evasion; an excuse.
phosphorated : (imp. & p. p.) of Phosphorate
purulency : (n.) The quality or state of being purulent; the generation of pus; also, the pus itself.
pentecosty : (n.) A troop of fifty soldiers in the Spartan army; -- called also pentecostys.
pistillaceous : (a.) Growing on, or having nature of, the pistil; of or pertaining to a pistil.
phragmocone : (n.) The thin chambered shell attached to the anterior end of a belemnite.
pyxidate : (a.) Having a pyxidium.
probatory : (a.) Serving for trial; probationary. | : (a.) Pertaining to, or serving for, proof.
pehlevi : (n.) An ancient Persian dialect in which words were partly represented by their Semitic equivalents. It was in use from the 3d century (and perhaps earlier) to the middle of the 7th century, and later in religious writings.
piacle : (n.) A heinous offense which requires expiation.
paronomasy : (n.) Paronomasia.
pneumonitis : (n.) Inflammation of the lungs; pneumonia.
paunching : (p. pr. & vb. n.) of Paunch
pretence : (a.) Alt. of Pretenceless | : (n.) The act of laying claim; the claim laid; assumption; pretension. | : (n.) The act of holding out, or offering, to others something false or feigned; presentation of what is deceptive or hypocritical; deception by showing what is unreal and concealing what is real; false show; simulation; as, pretense of illness; under pretense of patriotism; on pretense of revenging Caesar's death. | : (n.) That which is pretended; false, deceptive, or hypocritical show, argument, or reason; pretext; feint. | : (n.) Intention; design.
purcelane : (n.) Purslane.
participator : (n.) One who participates, or shares with another; a partaker.
phantastical : (a.) See Fantastic.
phonetically : (adv.) In a phonetic manner.
prettily : (adv.) In a pretty manner.
peristaltic : (a.) Applied to the peculiar wormlike wave motion of the intestines and other similar structures, produced by the successive contraction of the muscular fibers of their walls, forcing their contents onwards; as, peristaltic movement.
peach-colored : (a.) Of the color of a peach blossom.
pneumonitic : (a.) Of or pertaining to pneumonitis.
portfolio : (n.) A portable case for holding loose papers, prints, drawings, etc. | : (n.) Hence: The office and functions of a minister of state or member of the cabinet; as, to receive the portfolio of war; to resign the portfolio.
polyacron : (n.) A solid having many summits or angular points; a polyhedron.
photolithograph : (n.) A lithographic picture or copy from a stone prepared by the aid of photography. | : (v. t.) To produce (a picture, a copy) by the process of photolithography.

pleasantries : (pl. ) of Pleasantry

periuterine : (a.) Surrounding the uterus.
puzzledom : (n.) The domain of puzzles; puzzles, collectively.
perfectionist : (n.) One pretending to perfection; esp., one pretending to moral perfection; one who believes that persons may and do attain to moral perfection and sinlessness in this life.
podgy : (a.) Fat and short; pudgy.
partridge : (n.) Any one of numerous species of small gallinaceous birds of the genus Perdix and several related genera of the family Perdicidae, of the Old World. The partridge is noted as a game bird. | : (n.) Any one of several species of quail-like birds belonging to Colinus, and allied genera. | : (n.) The ruffed grouse (Bonasa umbellus).
paymaster : (n.) One who pays; one who compensates, rewards, or requites; specifically, an officer or agent of a government, a corporation, or an employer, whose duty it is to pay salaries, wages, etc., and keep account of the same.
procidentia : (n.) A falling down; a prolapsus.
posteriors : (n. pl.) The hinder parts, as of an animal's body.
procreative : (a.) Having the power to beget; generative.
palatopterygoid : (a.) Pertaining to the palatine and pterygoid region of the skull; as, the palatopterygoid cartilage, or rod, from which the palatine and pterygoid bones are developed.
palmacite : (n.) A fossil palm.
perfectionism : (n.) The doctrine of the Perfectionists.
pickle-herring : (n.) A herring preserved in brine; a pickled herring. | : (n.) A merry-andrew; a buffoon.
pigweed : (n.) A name of several annual weeds. See Goosefoot, and Lamb's-quarters.
preparing : (p. pr. & vb. n.) of Prepare
phytomeron : (n.) An organic element of a flowering plant; a phyton.
provision : (n.) The act of providing, or making previous preparation. | : (n.) That which is provided or prepared; that which is brought together or arranged in advance; measures taken beforehand; preparation. | : (n.) Especially, a stock of food; any kind of eatables collected or stored; -- often in the plural. | : (n.) That which is stipulated in advance; a condition; a previous agreement; a proviso; as, the provisions of a contract; the statute has many provisions. | : (n.) A canonical term for regular induction into a benefice, comprehending nomination, collation, and installation. | : (n.) A nomination by the pope to a benefice before it became vacant, depriving the patron of his right of presentation. | : (v. t.) To supply with food; to victual; as, to provision a garrison.
prongbuck : (n.) The springbuck. | : (n.) The pronghorn.

podge : (n.) A puddle; a plash. | : (n.) Porridge.
protomorphic : (a.) Having the most primitive character; in the earliest form; as, a protomorphic layer of tissue.
playgoing : (a.) Frequenting playhouses; as, the playgoing public. | : (n.) The practice of going to plays.

pachy- : ( ) A combining form meaning thick; as, pachyderm, pachydactyl.
platform : (n.) A plat; a plan; a sketch; a model; a pattern. Used also figuratively. | : (n.) A place laid out after a model. | : (n.) Any flat or horizontal surface; especially, one that is raised above some particular level, as a framework of timber or boards horizontally joined so as to form a roof, or a raised floor, or portion of a floor; a landing; a dais; a stage, for speakers, performers, or workmen; a standing place. | : (n.) A declaration of the principles upon which a person, a sect, or a party proposes to stand; a declared policy or system; as, the Saybrook platform; a political platform. | : (n.) A light deck, usually placed in a section of the hold or over the floor of the magazine. See Orlop. | : (v. t.) To place on a platform. | : (v. t.) To form a plan of; to model; to lay out.
poplin : (n.) A fabric of many varieties, usually made of silk and worsted, -- used especially for women's dresses.
paradisean : (a.) Paradisiacal.
piste : (n.) The track or tread a horseman makes upon the ground he goes over.
plenal : (a.) Full; complete; as, a plenal view or act.
porphyrize : (v. t.) To cause to resemble porphyry; to make spotted in composition, like porphyry.
parameter : (n.) A term applied to some characteristic magnitude whose value, invariable as long as one and the same function, curve, surface, etc., is considered, serves to distinguish that function, curve, surface, etc., from others of the same kind or family. | : (n.) Specifically (Conic Sections), in the ellipse and hyperbola, a third proportional to any diameter and its conjugate, or in the parabola, to any abscissa and the corresponding ordinate. | : (n.) The ratio of the three crystallographic axes which determines the position of any plane; also, the fundamental axial ratio for a given species.
poynado : (n.) A poniard.
preconcertion : (n.) The act of preconcerting; preconcert.
postfix : (n.) A letter, syllable, or word, added to the end of another word; a suffix. | : (v. t.) To annex; specifically (Gram.), to add or annex, as a letter, syllable, or word, to the end of another or principal word; to suffix.

passe partout : (n.) That by which one can pass anywhere; a safe-conduct. | : (n.) A master key; a latchkey. | : (n.) A light picture frame or mat of cardboard, wood, or the like, usually put between the picture and the glass, and sometimes serving for several pictures.
punnology : (n.) The art or practice of punning; paronomasia.
philhellene : (n.) A friend of Greece, or of the Greeks; a philhellenist.
pinite : (n.) A compact granular cryptocrystalline mineral of a dull grayish or greenish white color. It is a hydrous alkaline silicate, and is derived from the alteration of other minerals, as iolite. | : (n.) Any fossil wood which exhibits traces of having belonged to the Pine family. | : (n.) A sweet white crystalline substance extracted from the gum of a species of pine (Pinus Lambertina). It is isomeric with, and resembles, quercite.

pagodite : (n.) Agalmatolite; -- so called because sometimes carved by the Chinese into the form of pagodas. See Agalmatolite.

ponderousness : (n.) The quality or state of being ponderous; ponderosity.
prostrating : (p. pr. & vb. n.) of Prostrate
pectin : (n.) One of a series of carbohydrates, commonly called vegetable jelly, found very widely distributed in the vegetable kingdom, especially in ripe fleshy fruits, as apples, cranberries, etc. It is extracted as variously colored, translucent substances, which are soluble in hot water but become viscous on cooling.
phytolite : (n.) An old name for a fossil plant.
pedantic : (a.) Alt. of Pedantical
pectic : (a.) Of or pertaining to pectin; specifically, designating an acid obtained from ordinary vegetable jelly (pectin) as an amorphous substance, tough and horny when dry, but gelatinous when moist.
packer : (n.) A person whose business is to pack things; especially, one who packs food for preservation; as, a pork packer.
profferer : (n.) One who proffers something.
prenominal : (a.) Serving as a prefix in a compound name.
predestinarian : (a.) Of or pertaining to predestination; as, the predestinarian controversy. | : (n.) One who believes in or supports the doctrine of predestination.
panslavist : (n.) One who favors Panslavism.
pennigerous : (a.) Bearing feathers or quills.
proportional : (a.) Having a due proportion, or comparative relation; being in suitable proportion or degree; as, the parts of an edifice are proportional. | : (a.) Relating to, or securing, proportion. | : (a.) Constituting a proportion; having the same, or a constant, ratio; as, proportional quantities; momentum is proportional to quantity of matter. | : (n.) Any number or quantity in a proportion; as, a mean proportional. | : (n.) The combining weight or equivalent of an element.
packet : (n.) A small pack or package; a little bundle or parcel; as, a packet of letters. | : (n.) Originally, a vessel employed by government to convey dispatches or mails; hence, a vessel employed in conveying dispatches, mails, passengers, and goods, and having fixed days of sailing; a mail boat. | : (v. t.) To make up into a packet or bundle. | : (v. t.) To send in a packet or dispatch vessel. | : (v. i.) To ply with a packet or dispatch boat.
percolating : (p. pr. & vb. n.) of Percolate
panslavism : (n.) A scheme or desire to unite all the Slavic races into one confederacy.
planning : (p. pr. & vb. n.) of Plan
parbuckle : (n.) A kind of purchase for hoisting or lowering a cylindrical burden, as a cask. The middle of a long rope is made fast aloft, and both parts are looped around the object, which rests in the loops, and rolls in them as the ends are hauled up or payed out. | : (n.) A double sling made of a single rope, for slinging a cask, gun, etc. | : (v. t.) To hoist or lower by means of a parbuckle.
purbeck beds : ( ) The strata of the Purbeck stone, or Purbeck limestone, belonging to the Oolitic group. See the Chart of Geology.
phagedenical : (a.) Of, like, or pertaining to, phagedena; used in the treatment of phagedena; as, a phagedenic ulcer or medicine. | : (n.) A phagedenic medicine.
panopticon : (n.) A prison so contructed that the inspector can see each of the prisoners at all times, without being seen. | : (n.) A room for the exhibition of novelties.
pilfer : (v. i.) To steal in small quantities, or articles of small value; to practice petty theft. | : (v. t.) To take by petty theft; to filch; to steal little by little.
prudence : (n.) The quality or state of being prudent; wisdom in the way of caution and provision; discretion; carefulness; hence, also, economy; frugality.
pyrometer : (n.) An instrument used for measuring the expansion of solid bodies by heat. | : (n.) An instrument for measuring degrees of heat above those indicated by the mercurial thermometer.
perisome : (n.) The entire covering of an invertebrate animal, as echinoderm or coelenterate; the integument.
philomathy : (n.) The love of learning or letters.
pigeon-livered : (a.) Pigeon-hearted.
polypetalous : (a.) Consisting of, or having, several or many separate petals; as, a polypetalous corolla, flower, or plant.
peacher : (n.) One who peaches.
pentaspermous : (a.) Containing five seeds.
petasus : (n.) The winged cap of Mercury; also, a broad-brimmed, low-crowned hat worn by Greeks and Romans.
progressist : (n.) One who makes, or holds to, progress; a progressionist.

preaccusation : (n.) Previous accusation.
pungled : (a.) Shriveled or shrunken; -- said especially of grain which has lost its juices from the ravages of insects, such as the wheat midge, or Trips (Thrips cerealium).
paleotherium : (n.) An extinct genus of herbivorous Tertiary mammals, once supposed to have resembled the tapir in form, but now known to have had a more slender form, with a long neck like that of a llama.
preterhuman : (a.) More than human.
pullulation : (n.) A germinating, or budding.

One invested with royal privileges and rights within his domains; a count palatine. See Count palatine, under 4th Count. | : (n.) The Palatine hill in Rome. | : (a.) The pubic bone. | : (n.) Any species of bivalve mollusks of the genus Pecten, and numerous allied genera (family Pectinidae); a scallop. See Scallop. | : (n.) The comb of a scorpion. See Comb, 4 (b).

palaetiology : (n.) The science which explains, by the law of causation, the past condition and changes of the earth.
pyrophorus : (n.) Any one of several substances or mixtures which phosphoresce or ignite spontaneously on exposure to air, as a heated mixture of alum, potash, and charcoal, or a mixture of charcoal and finely divided lead.

paunched : (imp. & p. p.) of Paunch
podagrous : (a.) Gouty; podagric.
praetexta : (n.) A white robe with a purple border, worn by a Roman boy before he was entitled to wear the toga virilis, or until about the completion of his fourteenth year, and by girls until their marriage. It was also worn by magistrates and priests.
predecease : (v. t.) To die sooner than. | : (n.) The death of one person or thing before another.
podesta : (n.) One of the chief magistrates of the Italian republics in the Middle Ages. | : (n.) A mayor, alderman, or other magistrate, in some towns of Italy.
pyretic : (a.) Of or pertaining to fever; febrile.
precurse : (n.) A forerunning.
private : (a.) Belonging to, or concerning, an individual person, company, or interest; peculiar to one's self; unconnected with others; personal; one's own; not public; not general; separate; as, a man's private opinion; private property; a private purse; private expenses or interests; a private secretary. | : (a.) Sequestered from company or observation; appropriated to an individual; secret; secluded; lonely; solitary; as, a private room or apartment; private prayer. | : (a.) Not invested with, or engaged in, public office or employment; as, a private citizen; private life. | : (a.) Not publicly known; not open; secret; as, a private negotiation; a private understanding. | : (a.) Having secret or private knowledge; privy. | : (n.) A secret message; a personal unofficial communication. | : (n.) Personal interest; particular business. | : (n.) Privacy; retirement. | : (n.) One not invested with a public office. | : (n.) A common soldier; a soldier below the grade of a noncommissioned officer. | : (n.) The private parts; the genitals.
patulous : (a.) Open; expanded; slightly spreading; having the parts loose or dispersed; as, a patulous calyx; a patulous cluster of flowers.
prefecundatory : (a.) Of or pertaining to prefecundation.
prinking : (p. pr. & vb. n.) of Prink
phalaena : (n.) A linnaean genus which included the moths in general.
pipal tree : ( ) Same as Peepul tree.
paucity : (n.) Fewness; smallness of number; scarcity. | : (n.) Smallnes of quantity; exiguity; insufficiency; as, paucity of blood.
peopled : (imp. & p. p.) of People | : (a.) Stocked with, or as with, people; inhabited.
podley : (n.) A young coalfish.
percolation : (n.) The act or process of percolating, or filtering; filtration; straining. Specifically (Pharm.), the process of exhausting the virtues of a powdered drug by letting a liquid filter slowly through it.
pooled : (imp. & p. p.) of Pool
prejudicacy : (n.) Prejudice; prepossession.
picturing : (p. pr. & vb. n.) of Picture
proportioned : (imp. & p. p.) of Proportion
phenogamian : (a.) Alt. of Phenogamous
platitudinous : (a.) Abounding in platitudes; of the nature of platitudes; uttering platitudes.
pentahedron : (n.) A solid figure having five sides.
packed : (imp. & p. p.) of Pack
pistillation : (n.) The act of pounding or breaking in a mortar; pestillation.
predestinate : (a.) Predestinated; foreordained; fated. | : (v. t.) To predetermine or foreordain; to appoint or ordain beforehand by an unchangeable purpose or decree; to preelect.
periclase : (n.) Alt. of Periclasite
preoccupation : (n.) The act of preoccupying, or taking possession of beforehand; the state of being preoccupied; prepossession. | : (n.) Anticipation of objections.
pageant : (n.) A theatrical exhibition; a spectacle. | : (n.) An elaborate exhibition devised for the entertainmeut of a distinguished personage, or of the public; a show, spectacle, or display. | : (a.) Of the nature of a pageant; spectacular. | : (v. t.) To exhibit in show; to represent; to mimic.
preciousness : (n.) The quality or state of being precious; costliness; dearness.
pronephros : (n.) Alt. of Pronephron
pouncet box : ( ) A box with a perforated lid, for sprinkling pounce, or for holding perfumes.
purprise : (n.) A close or inclosure; the compass of a manor.
pronephron : (n.) The head kidney. See under Head.
prelatically : (adv.) In a prelatical manner; with reference to prelates.
pulpit : (n.) An elevated place, or inclosed stage, in a church, in which the clergyman stands while preaching. | : (n.) The whole body of the clergy; preachers as a class; also, preaching. | : (n.) A desk, or platform, for an orator or public speaker. | : (a.) Of or pertaining to the pulpit, or preaching; as, a pulpit orator; pulpit eloquence.
pricking-up : (n.) The first coating of plaster in work of three coats upon laths. Its surface is scratched once to form a better key for the next coat. In the United States called scratch coat.
paolo : (n.) An old Italian silver coin, worth about ten cents.
-rias : (pl. ) of Planaria
progressive : (a.) Moving forward; proceeding onward; advancing; evincing progress; increasing; as, progressive motion or course; -- opposed to retrograde. | : (a.) Improving; as, art is in a progressive state.
pilchard : (n.) A small European food fish (Clupea pilchardus) resembling the herring, but thicker and rounder. It is sometimes taken in great numbers on the coast of England.
pronounce : (v. t.) To utter articulately; to speak out or distinctly; to utter, as words or syllables; to speak with the proper sound and accent as, adults rarely learn to pronounce a foreign language correctly. | : (v. t.) To utter officially or solemnly; to deliver, as a decree or sentence; as, to pronounce sentence of death. | : (v. t.) To speak or utter rhetorically; to deliver; to recite; as, to pronounce an oration. | : (v. t.) To declare or affirm; as, he pronounced the book to be a libel; he pronounced the act to be a fraud. | : (v. i.) To give a pronunciation; to articulate; as, to pronounce faultlessly. | : (v. i.) To make declaration; to utter on opinion; to speak with confidence. | : (n.) Pronouncement; declaration; pronunciation.
pilfering : (p. pr. & vb. n.) of Pilfer | : (a.) Thieving in a small way. | : (n.) Petty theft.
pellack : (n.) A porpoise.
plaiding : (n.) Plaid cloth.
pathmaker : (n.) One who, or that which, makes a way or path.
perviousness : (n.) The quality or state of being pervious; as, the perviousness of glass.
prejudicating : (p. pr. & vb. n.) of Prejudicate
polypode : (n.) A plant of the genus Polypodium; polypody. | : (n.) An animal having many feet; a myriapod.
psychiatric : (a.) Of or pertaining to psychiatria.
penthouse : (n.) A shed or roof sloping from the main wall or building, as over a door or window; a lean-to. Also figuratively. | : (a.) Leaning; overhanging.
pipage : (n.) Transportation, as of petroleum oil, by means of a pipe conduit; also, the charge for such transportation.
psychiatria : (n.) Alt. of Psychiatry
prevailment : (n.) Prevalence; superior influence; efficacy.
petalosticha : (n. pl.) An order of Echini, including the irregular sea urchins, as the spatangoids. See Spatangoid.

primerole : (n.) See Primrose.

polypody : (n.) Any plant of the genus Polypodium.
pustule : (n.) A vesicle or an elevation of the cuticle with an inflamed base, containing pus.
pathogenic : (a.) Of or pertaining to pathogeny; producting disease; as, a pathogenic organism; a pathogenic bacterium.

purloined : (imp. & p. p.) of Purloin
parnassian : (a.) Of or pertaining to Parnassus. | : (n.) Any one of numerous species of butterflies belonging to the genus Parnassius. They inhabit the mountains, both in the Old World and in America.
placability : (n.) The quality or state of being placable or appeasable; placable disposition.
perfusive : (a.) Of a nature to flow over, or to spread through.
pertinent : (a.) Belonging or related to the subject or matter in hand; fit or appropriate in any way; adapted to the end proposed; apposite; material; relevant; as, pertinent illustrations or arguments; pertinent evidence. | : (a.) Regarding; concerning; belonging; pertaining.
ploughpoint : (n.) A detachable share at the extreme front end of the plow body.
phonographer : (n.) One versed or skilled in phonography. | : (n.) One who uses, or is skilled in the use of, the phonograph. See Phonograph, 2.
picturize : (v. t.) To picture. | : (v. t.) To adorn with pictures.
postlude : (n.) A voluntary at the end of a service.
premit : (v. t.) To premise.
prosimiae : (n. pl.) Same as Lemuroidea.
prussic : (a.) designating the acid now called hydrocyanic acid, but formerly called prussic acid, because Prussian blue is derived from it or its compounds. See Hydrocyanic.
persecuted : (imp. & p. p.) of Persecute
phonographic : (a.) Alt. of Phonographical
puttock : (n.) The European kite. | : (n.) The buzzard. | : (n.) The marsh harrier. | : (n.) See Futtock.
picnicked : (imp. & p. p.) of Picnic
prolongable : (a.) Capable of being prolonged; as, life is prolongable by care.
parquet : (n.) A body of seats on the floor of a music hall or theater nearest the orchestra; but commonly applied to the whole lower floor of a theater, from the orchestra to the dress circle; the pit. | : (n.) Same as Parquetry.
phytolithology : (n.) The branch of science which treats of fossil plants; -- usually called paleobotany, sometimes paleophytology.
protruding : (p. pr. & vb. n.) of Protrude
parochialism : (n.) The quality or state of being parochial in form or nature; a system of management peculiar to parishes.
pilfery : (n.) Petty theft.
prolongment : (n.) Prolongation.
pauper : (n.) A poor person; especially, one development on private or public charity. Also used adjectively; as, pouper immigrants, pouper labor.
projet : (n.) A plan proposed; a draft of a proposed measure; a project.
picnicker : (n.) One who takes part in a picnic.
prejudication : (n.) The act of prejudicating, or of judging without due examination of facts and evidence; prejudgment. | : (n.) A preliminary inquiry and determination about something which belongs to a matter in dispute. | : (n.) A previous treatment and decision of a point; a precedent.
piecely : (adv.) In pieces; piecemeal.
practicalness : (n.) Same as Practicality.

plank-sheer : (n.) The course of plank laid horizontally over the timberheads of a vessel's frame.
pervicacity : (n.) Obstinacy; pervicaciousness.
polynomial : (n.) An expression composed of two or more terms, connected by the signs plus or minus; as, a2 - 2ab + b2. | : (a.) Containing many names or terms; multinominal; as, the polynomial theorem. | : (a.) Consisting of two or more words; having names consisting of two or more words; as, a polynomial name; polynomial nomenclature.
pangolin : (n.) Any one of several species of Manis, Pholidotus, and related genera, found in Africa and Asia. They are covered with imbricated scales, and feed upon ants. Called also scaly ant-eater.
para grass : ( ) A valuable pasture grass (Panicum barbinode) introduced into the Southern United States from Brazil.
pentremite : (n.) Any species of Pentremites.
portative : (a.) Portable. | : (a.) Capable of holding up or carrying; as, the portative force of a magnet, of atmospheric pressure, or of capillarity.

piracies : (pl. ) of Piracy
privities : (pl. ) of Privity
prejudicant : (a.) Influenced by prejudice; biased.
publishment : (n.) The act or process of making publicly known; publication. | : (n.) A public notice of intended marriage, required by the laws of some States.
pedagogy : (n.) Pedagogics; pedagogism.
publishable : (a.) Capable of being published; suitable for publication.
palmitic : (a.) Pertaining to, or obtained from, palmitin or palm oil; as, palmitic acid, a white crystalline body belonging to the fatty acid series. It is readily soluble in hot alcohol, and melts to a liquid oil at 62! C.
pyrite : (n.) A common mineral of a pale brass-yellow color and brilliant metallic luster, crystallizing in the isometric system; iron pyrites; iron disulphide.
protectiveness : (n.) The quality or state of being protective.
psychosis : (n.) Any vital action or activity. | : (n.) A disease of the mind; especially, a functional mental disorder, that is, one unattended with evident organic changes.
perception : (n.) The act of perceiving; cognizance by the senses or intellect; apperhension by the bodily organs, or by the mind, of what is presented to them; discernment; apperhension; cognition. | : (n.) The faculty of perceiving; the faculty, or peculiar part, of man's constitution by which he has knowledge through the medium or instrumentality of the bodily organs; the act of apperhending material objects or qualities through the senses; -- distinguished from conception. | : (n.) The quality, state, or capability, of being affected by something external; sensation; sensibility. | : (n.) An idea; a notion.
precessional : (a.) Of or pertaining to pression; as, the precessional movement of the equinoxes.
pollicitation : (n.) A voluntary engagement, or a paper containing it; a promise. | : (n.) A promise without mutuality; a promise which has not been accepted by the person to whom it is made.

praemunitory : (a.) See Premunitory.
pliocene : (a.) Of, pertaining to, or characterizing, the most recent division of the Tertiary age. | : (n.) The Pliocene period or deposits.
perchloric : (a.) Pertaining to, or designating, the highest oxygen acid (HClO4), of chlorine; -- called also hyperchloric.

pourlieu : (n.) See Purlieu.
prairial : (n.) The ninth month of the French Republican calendar, which dated from September 22, 1792. It began May, 20, and ended June 18. See Vendemiaire.
pythonic : (a.) Prophetic; oracular; pretending to foretell events.
pantelegraph : (n.) See under Telegraph.
pixies : (pl. ) of Pixie
platness : (n.) Flatness.

pernancy : (n.) A taking or reception, as the receiving of rents or tithes in kind, the receiving of profits.

Regular or proportional advance in increase or decrease of numbers; continued proportion, arithmetical, geometrical, or harmonic. | : (n.) A regular succession of tones or chords; the movement of the parts in harmony; the order of the modulations in a piece from key to key.

Proceeding from, or dictated or characterized by, prudence; prudent; discreet; sometimes, selfish or pecuniary as distinguished from higher motives or influences; as, prudential motives. | : (a.) Exercising prudence; discretionary; advisory; superintending or executive; as, a prudential committee. | : (n.) That which relates to or demands the exercise of, discretion or prudence; -- usually in the pl.

promulgated : (imp. & p. p.) of Promulgate

To violate sexually; to debauch; to dishonor. | : (v. t.) To render ceremonially unclean; to disqualify or unfit for sacred use or service, or for social intercourse. | : (a.) Polluted.
packwax : (n.) Same as Paxwax.
propensities : (pl. ) of Propensity
packway : (n.) A path, as over mountains, followed by pack animals.
phenakistoscope : (n.) A revolving disk on which figures drawn in different relative attitudes are seen successively, so as to produce the appearance of an object in actual motion, as an animal leaping, etc., in consequence of the persistence of the successive visual impressions of the retina. It is often arranged so that the figures may be projected upon a screen.
promissory : (a.) Containing a promise or binding declaration of something to be done or forborne.
pittle-pattle : (v. i.) To talk unmeaningly; to chatter or prattle.
pronged : (a.) Having prongs or projections like the tines of a fork; as, a three-pronged fork.
propulse : (v. t.) To repel; to drive off or away.
plethrum : (n.) A long measure of 100 Greek, or 101 English, feet; also, a square measure of 10,000 Greek feet.
puing : (p. pr. & vb. n.) of Pue
porkwood : (n.) The coarse-grained brownish yellow wood of a small tree (Pisonia obtusata) of Florida and the West Indies. Also called pigeon wood, beefwood, and corkwood.
panderous : (a.) Of or relating to a pander; characterizing a pander.
perchant : (n.) A bird tied by the foot, to serve as decoy to other birds by its fluttering.
peppery : (a.) Of or pertaining to pepper; having the qualities of pepper; hot; pungent. | : (a.) Fig.: Hot-tempered; passionate; choleric.

palampore : (n.) See Palempore.
pallial : (a.) Of or pretaining to a mantle, especially to the mantle of mollusks; produced by the mantle; as, the pallial line, or impression, which marks the attachment of the mantle on the inner surface of a bivalve shell. See Illust. of Bivalve.
plano-convex : (a.) Plane or flat on one side, and convex on the other; as, a plano-convex lens. See Convex, and Lens.
progressing : (p. pr. & vb. n.) of Progress
pryingly : (adv.) In a prying manner.
permiscible : (a.) Capable of being mixed.
pencil : (n.) A small, fine brush of hair or bristles used by painters for laying on colors. | : (n.) A slender cylinder or strip of black lead, colored chalk, slate etc., or such a cylinder or strip inserted in a small wooden rod intended to be pointed, or in a case, which forms a handle, -- used for drawing or writing. See Graphite. | : (n.) Hence, figuratively, an artist's ability or peculiar manner; also, in general, the act or occupation of the artist, descriptive writer, etc. | : (n.) An aggregate or collection of rays of light, especially when diverging from, or converging to, a point. | : (n.) A number of lines that intersect in one point, the point of intersection being called the pencil point. | : (n.) A small medicated bougie. | : (v. t.) To write or mark with a pencil; to paint or to draw.

pricking : (p. pr. & vb. n.) of Prick | : (n.) The act of piercing or puncturing with a sharp point. | : (n.) The driving of a nail into a horse's foot so as to produce lameness. | : (n.) Same as Nicking. | : (n.) A sensation of being pricked. | : (n.) The mark or trace left by a hare's foot; a prick; also, the act of tracing a hare by its footmarks. | : (n.) Dressing one's self for show; prinking.
prostration : (n.) The act of prostrating, throwing down, or laying fiat; as, the prostration of the body. | : (n.) The act of falling down, or of bowing in humility or adoration; primarily, the act of falling on the face, but usually applied to kneeling or bowing in reverence and worship. | : (n.) The condition of being prostrate; great depression; lowness; dejection; as, a postration of spirits. | : (n.) A latent, not an exhausted, state of the vital energies; great oppression of natural strength and vigor.
pharmacopolist : (n.) One who sells medicines; an apothecary.
photorelief : (n.) A printing surface in relief, obtained by photographic means and subsequent manipulations.
polynuclear : (a.) Containing many nuclei.
paganized : (imp. & p. p.) of Paganize
palmitin : (n.) A solid crystallizable fat, found abundantly in animals and in vegetables. It occurs mixed with stearin and olein in the fat of animal tissues, with olein and butyrin in butter, with olein in olive oil, etc. Chemically, it is a glyceride of palmitic acid, three molecules of palmitic acid being united to one molecule of glyceryl, and hence it is technically called tripalmitin, or glyceryl tripalmitate.
participantly : (adv.) In a participant manner.
phonation : (n.) The act or process by which articulate sounds are uttered; the utterance of articulate sounds; articulate speech.
preseance : (n.) Priority of place in sitting.

prefinite : (a.) Prearranged.
phenogamia : (n. pl.) Same as Phaenogamia.
phenogamic : (a.) Alt. of Phenogamous
promulgator : (n.) One who promulgates or publishes.
pliosaurus : (n.) An extinct genus of marine reptiles allied to Plesiosaurus, but having a much shorter neck.
pantalet : (n.) One of the legs of the loose drawers worn by children and women; particularly, the lower part of such a garment, coming below the knee, often made in a separate piece; -- chiefly in the plural.
pharmaceutist : (n.) One skilled in pharmacy; a druggist. See the Note under Apothecary.
plain-hearted : (a.) Frank; sincere; artless.
pangenetic : (a.) Of or pertaining to pangenesis.
pieno : (a.) Full; having all the instruments.
pounds : (pl. ) of Pound | : (pl. ) of Pound
piend : (n.) See Peen.
pivot : (n.) A fixed pin or short axis, on the end of which a wheel or other body turns. | : (n.) The end of a shaft or arbor which rests and turns in a support; as, the pivot of an arbor in a watch. | : (n.) Hence, figuratively: A turning point or condition; that on which important results depend; as, the pivot of an enterprise. | : (n.) The officer or soldier who simply turns in his place whike the company or line moves around him in wheeling; -- called also pivot man. | : (v. t.) To place on a pivot.
phanerogamian : (a.) Phanerogamous.
pyrophoric : (a.) Alt. of Pyrophorous
pock-fretten : (a.) See Pockmarked.
palatial : (a.) Of or pertaining to a palace; suitable for a palace; resembling a palace; royal; magnificent; as, palatial structures. | : (a.) Palatal; palatine. | : (n.) A palatal letter.
phonograph : (n.) A character or symbol used to represent a sound, esp. one used in phonography. | : (n.) An instrument for the mechanical registration and reproduction of audible sounds, as articulate speech, etc. It consists of a rotating cylinder or disk covered with some material easily indented, as tinfoil, wax, paraffin, etc., above which is a thin plate carrying a stylus. As the plate vibrates under the influence of a sound, the stylus makes minute indentations or undulations in the soft material, and these, when the cylinder or disk is again turned, set the plate in vibration, and reproduce the sound.
pikrolite : (n.) See Picrolite.
pontifically : (adv.) In a pontifical manner.
personating : (p. pr. & vb. n.) of Personate
prickly : (a.) Full of sharp points or prickles; armed or covered with prickles; as, a prickly shrub.
pileate : (a.) Alt. of Pileated
panym : (n. & a.) See Panim.
potestate : (n.) A chief ruler; a potentate. [Obs.] Wyclif.
periodicalist : (n.) One who publishes, or writes for, a periodical.
pitchwork : (n.) The work of a coal miner who is paid by a share of his product.
pentyl : (n.) The hypothetical radical, C5H11, of pentane and certain of its derivatives. Same as Amyl.
prattling : (p. pr. & vb. n.) of Prattle
prickle : (n.) A little prick; a small, sharp point; a fine, sharp process or projection, as from the skin of an animal, the bark of a plant, etc.; a spine. | : (n.) A kind of willow basket; -- a term still used in some branches of trade. | : (n.) A sieve of filberts, -- about fifty pounds. | : (v. t.) To prick slightly, as with prickles, or fine, sharp points.

plundering : (p. pr. & vb. n.) of Plunder

persulphocyanate : (n.) A salt of persulphocyanic acid.
pounce : (n.) A fine powder, as of sandarac, or cuttlefish bone, -- formerly used to prevent ink from spreading on manuscript. | : (n.) Charcoal dust, or some other colored powder for making patterns through perforated designs, -- used by embroiderers, lace makers, etc. | : (v. t.) To sprinkle or rub with pounce; as, to pounce paper, or a pattern. | : (v. t.) The claw or talon of a bird of prey. | : (v. t.) A punch or stamp. | : (v. t.) Cloth worked in eyelet holes. | : (v. t.) To strike or seize with the talons; to pierce, as with the talons. | : (v. t.) To punch; to perforate; to stamp holes in, or dots on, by way of ornament. | : (v. i.) To fall suddenly and seize with the claws; -- with on or upon; as, a hawk pounces upon a chicken. Also used figuratively.
puppetry : (n.) Action or appearance resembling that of a puppet, or puppet show; hence, mere form or show; affectation.
propense : (a.) Leaning toward, in a moral sense; inclined; disposed; prone; as, women propense to holiness.
phatagin : (n.) The long-tailed pangolin (Manis tetradactyla); -- called also ipi.
paleontology : (n.) The science which treats of the ancient life of the earth, or of fossils which are the remains of such life.
protist : (n.) One of the Protista.
poachy : (a.) Wet and soft; easily penetrated by the feet of cattle; -- said of land
postillator : (n.) One who postillates; one who expounds the Scriptures verse by verse.
porcupine : (n.) Any Old Word rodent of the genus Hystrix, having the back covered with long, sharp, erectile spines or quills, sometimes a foot long. The common species of Europe and Asia (Hystrix cristata) is the best known. | : (n.) Any species of Erethizon and related genera, native of America. They are related to the true porcupines, but have shorter spines, and are arboreal in their habits. The Canada porcupine (Erethizon dorsatus) is a well known species.
phrentic : (n. & a.) See Phrenetic.
propugnacle : (n.) A fortress.
praecocial : (a.) Of or pertaining to the Praecoces.
purana : (n.) One of a class of sacred Hindoo poetical works in the Sanskrit language which treat of the creation, destruction, and renovation of worlds, the genealogy and achievements of gods and heroes, the reigns of the Manus, and the transactions of their descendants. The principal Puranas are eighteen in number, and there are the same number of supplementary books called Upa Puranas.
portland stone : ( ) A yellowish-white calcareous freestone from the Isle of Portland in England, much used in building.
paternally : (adv.) In a paternal manner.
predatorily : (adv.) In a predatory manner.
plighting : (p. pr. & vb. n.) of Plight
protosalt : (n.) A salt derived from a protoxide base.
pettifogger : (n.) A lawyer who deals in petty cases; an attorney whose methods are mean and tricky; an inferior lawyer.
plesiosaur : (n.) One of the Plesiosauria.
preregnant : (n.) One who reigns before another; a sovereign predecessor.
psalteria : (pl. ) of Psalterium
paragrammatist : (n.) A punster.
pasigraphical : (a.) Of or pertaining to pasigraphy.
personation : (n.) The act of personating, or conterfeiting the person or character of another.
putty-faced : (a.) White-faced; -- used contemptuously.
polyphonous : (a.) Same as Polyphonic.
polychoerany : (n.) A government by many chiefs, princes, or rules.
pentagynous : (a.) Of or pertaining to plants of the order Pentagyna; having five styles.
penalties : (pl. ) of Penalty
presently : (adv.) At present; at this time; now. | : (adv.) At once; without delay; forthwith; also, less definitely, soon; shortly; before long; after a little while; by and by. | : (adv.) With actual presence; actually .
pettish : (a.) Fretful; peevish; moody; capricious; inclined to ill temper.
pulchritude : (n.) That quality of appearance which pleases the eye; beauty; comeliness; grace; loveliness. | : (n.) Attractive moral excellence; moral beauty.
papular : (a.) Covered with papules. | : (a.) Consisting of papules; characterized by the presence of papules; as, a papular eruption.
parenetioal : (a.) Hortatory; encouraging; persuasive.
polyrhizous : (a.) Having numerous roots, or rootlets.
pulverous : (a.) Consisting of dust or powder; like powder.
preadamitic : (a.) Existing or occurring before Adam; preadamic; as, preadamitic periods.
puttered : (imp. & p. p.) of Putter
pensionary : (a.) Maintained by a pension; receiving a pension; as, pensionary spies. | : (a.) Consisting of a pension; as, a pensionary provision for maintenance. | : (n.) One who receives a pension; a pensioner. | : (n.) One of the chief magistrates of towns in Holland.
provost : (n.) A person who is appointed to superintend, or preside over, something; the chief magistrate in some cities and towns; as, the provost of Edinburgh or of Glasgow, answering to the mayor of other cities; the provost of a college, answering to president; the provost or head of certain collegiate churches. | : (n.) The keeper of a prison.
pentahedral : (a.) Having five sides; as, a pentahedral figure.
precompose : (v. t.) To compose beforehand.
phytonomy : (n.) The science of the origin and growth of plants.
pectus : (n.) The breast of a bird.
puzzolan : (n.) Alt. of Puzzolana
pleomorphous : (a.) Having the property of pleomorphism.
pendulum : (n.) A body so suspended from a fixed point as to swing freely to and fro by the alternate action of gravity and momentum. It is used to regulate the movements of clockwork and other machinery.
palely : (a.) In a pale manner; dimly; wanly; not freshly or ruddily.
prefloration : (n.) Aestivation.
portionist : (n.) A scholar at Merton College, Oxford, who has a certain academical allowance or portion; -- corrupted into postmaster. | : (n.) One of the incumbents of a benefice which has two or more rectors or vicars.
pieta : (n.) A representation of the dead Christ, attended by the Virgin Mary or by holy women and angels.
physeter : (n.) The genus that includes the sperm whale. | : (n.) A filtering machine operated by air pressure.
puzzel : (n.) A harlot; a drab; a hussy.
primitively : (adv.) Originally; at first. | : (adv.) Primarily; not derivatively. | : (adv.) According to the original rule or ancient practice; in the ancient style.
pursuantly : (adv.) Agreeably; conformably.
poppied : (a.) Mingled or interspersed with poppies. | : (a.) Affected with poppy juice; hence, figuratively, drugged; drowsy; listless; inactive.
parisian : (n.) A native or inhabitant of Paris, the capital of France. | : (a.) Of or pertaining to Paris.
perciform : (a.) Pertaining to the Perciformes.
prosobranch : (n.) One of the Prosobranchiata.
palustral : (a.) Of or pertaining to a bog or marsh; boggy.
patriotism : (n.) Love of country; devotion to the welfare of one's country; the virtues and actions of a patriot; the passion which inspires one to serve one's country.
poppies : (pl. ) of Poppy
proboscidifera : (n. pl.) An extensive division of pectinibranchiate gastropods, including those that have a long retractile proboscis, with the mouth at the end, as the cones, whelks, tritons, and cowries. See Illust. of Gastropoda, and of Winkle. | : (n. pl.) A subdivision of the taenioglossate gastropods, including the fig-shells (Pyrula), the helmet shells (Cassis), the tritons, and allied genera.
papulae : (pl. ) of Papula
phallus : (n.) The emblem of the generative power in nature, carried in procession in the Bacchic orgies, or worshiped in various ways. | : (n.) The penis or clitoris, or the embryonic or primitive organ from which either may be derived. | : (n.) A genus of fungi which have a fetid and disgusting odor; the stinkhorn.
physic : (n.) The art of healing diseases; the science of medicine; the theory or practice of medicine. | : (n.) A specific internal application for the cure or relief of sickness; a remedy for disease; a medicine. | : (n.) Specifically, a medicine that purges; a cathartic. | : (n.) A physician. | : (v. t.) To treat with physic or medicine; to administer medicine to, esp. a cathartic; to operate on as a cathartic; to purge. | : (v. t.) To work on as a remedy; to heal; to cure.
perishability : (n.) Perishableness.
pizzicato : ( ) A direction to violinists to pluck the string with the finger, instead of using the bow. (Abrev. pizz.)
palpocil : (n.) A minute soft filamentary process springing from the surface of certain hydroids and sponges.
paleograph : (n.) An ancient manuscript.
postponer : (n.) One who postpones.
parleys : (pl. ) of Parley
preadjustment : (n.) Previous adjustment.

pseudopupas : (pl. ) of Pseudopupa
patelliform : (a.) Having the form of a patella. | : (a.) Resembling a limpet of the genus Patella.
portico : (n.) A colonnade or covered ambulatory, especially in classical styles of architecture; usually, a colonnade at the entrance of a building.
perfervid : (a.) Very fervid; too fervid; glowing; ardent.
postponed : (imp. & p. p.) of Postpone
pseudopupae : (pl. ) of Pseudopupa
paleo- : ( ) A combining form meaning old, ancient; as, palearctic, paleontology, paleothere, paleography.
pteron : (n.) The region of the skull, in the temporal fossa back of the orbit, where the great wing of the sphenoid, the temporal, the parietal, and the frontal hones approach each other.
poachiness : (n.) The state of being poachy; marshiness.
paleolithic : (a.) Of or pertaining to an era marked by early stone implements. The Paleolithic era (as proposed by Lubbock) includes the earlier half of the "Stone Age;" the remains belonging to it are for the most part of extinct animals, with relics of human beings.
polyacra : (pl. ) of Polyacron
phosphoresce : (v. i.) To shine as phosphorus; to be phosphorescent; to emit a phosphoric light.
poxed : (imp. & p. p.) of Pox
possessor : (n.) One who possesses; one who occupies, holds, owns, or controls; one who has actual participation or enjoyment, generally of that which is desirable; a proprietor.
papier-mache : (n.) A hard and strong substance made of a pulp from paper, mixed with sise or glue, etc. It is formed into various articles, usually by means of molds.
placated : (imp. & p. p.) of Placate
prosdist : (n.) One skilled in prosody.
pargeting : (p. pr. & vb. n.) of Parget | : (n.) Plasterwork; esp.: (a) A kind of decorative plasterwork in raised ornamental figures, formerly used for the internal and external decoration of houses. (b) In modern architecture, the plastering of the inside of flues, intended to give a smooth surface and help the draught.
planiform : (a.) Having a plane surface; as, a planiform, gliding, or arthrodial articulation.
priestliness : (n.) The quality or state of being priestly.
presbyteral : (a.) Of or pertaining to a presbyter or presbytery; presbyterial.
potestative : (a.) Authoritative.
play : (n.) To engage in sport or lively recreation; to exercise for the sake of amusement; to frolic; to spot. | : (n.) To act with levity or thoughtlessness; to trifle; to be careless. | : (n.) To contend, or take part, in a game; as, to play ball; hence, to gamble; as, he played for heavy stakes. | : (n.) To perform on an instrument of music; as, to play on a flute. | : (n.) To act; to behave; to practice deception. | : (n.) To move in any manner; especially, to move regularly with alternate or reciprocating motion; to operate; to act; as, the fountain plays. | : (n.) To move gayly; to wanton; to disport. | : (n.) To act on the stage; to personate a character. | : (v. t.) To put in action or motion; as, to play cannon upon a fortification; to play a trump. | : (v. t.) To perform music upon; as, to play the flute or the organ. | : (v. t.) To perform, as a piece of music, on an instrument; as, to play a waltz on the violin. | : (v. t.) To bring into sportive or wanton action; to exhibit in action; to execute; as, to play tricks. | : (v. t.) To act or perform (a play); to represent in music action; as, to play a comedy; also, to act in the character of; to represent by acting; to simulate; to behave like; as, to play King Lear; to play the woman. | : (v. t.) To engage in, or go together with, as a contest for amusement or for a wager or prize; as, to play a game at baseball. | : (v. t.) To keep in play, as a hooked fish, in order to land it. | : (n.) Amusement; sport; frolic; gambols. | : (n.) Any exercise, or series of actions, intended for amusement or diversion; a game. | : (n.) The act or practice of contending for victory, amusement, or a prize, as at dice, cards, or billiards; gaming; as, to lose a fortune in play. | : (n.) Action; use; employment; exercise; practice; as, fair play; sword play; a play of wit. | : (n.) A dramatic composition; a comedy or tragedy; a composition in which characters are represented by dialogue and action. | : (n.) The representation or exhibition of a comedy or tragedy; as, he attends ever play. | : (n.) Performance on an instrument of music. | : (n.) Motion; movement, regular or irregular; as, the play of a wheel or piston; hence, also, room for motion; free and easy action. | : (n.) Hence, liberty of acting; room for enlargement or display; scope; as, to give full play to mirth.

A priming wire; a priming needle, -- used in blasting and gunnery. | : (n.) A small marline spike having generally a wooden handle, -- used in sailmaking.

pouch-shell : (n.) A small British and American pond snail (Bulinus hypnorum).

perivascular : (a.) Around the blood vessels; as, perivascular lymphatics.

pentadactyloid : (a.) Having the form of, or a structure modified from, a pentadactyl limb.

protopine : (n.) An alkaloid found in opium in small quantities, and extracted as a white crystalline substance.

Openly given up to lewdness; devoted to base or infamous purposes. | : (n.) A woman giver to indiscriminate lewdness; a strumpet; a harlot. | : (n.) prakrit : (n.) Any one of the popular dialects descended from, or akin to, Sanskrit; -- in distinction from the Sanskrit, which was used as a literary and learned language when no longer spoken by the people. Pali is one of the Prakrit dialects.

The part of an estate given to a child or heir, or descending to him by law, and distributed to him in the settlement of the estate; an inheritance. | : (n.) A wife's fortune; a dowry. | : (v. t.) prytaneum : (n.) A public building in certain Greek cities; especially, a public hall in Athens regarded as the home of the community, in which official hospitality was extended to distinguished citizens and strangers.

Of or pertaining to air, or to elastic fluids or their properties; pertaining to pneumatics; as, pneumatic experiments. | : (a.) Moved or worked by pressure or flow of air; as, a pneumatic instrument; a pneumatic engine. | : (a.) Fitted to contain air; Having cavities filled with air; as, pneumatic cells; pneumatic bones.
phaseolus : (n.) A genus of leguminous plants, including the Lima bean, the kidney bean, the scarlet runner, etc. See Bean.
pharyngotomy : (n.) The operation of making an incision into the pharynx, to remove a tumor or anything that obstructs the passage. | : (n.) Scarification or incision of the tonsils.
preterlegal : (a.) Exceeding the limits of law.
propenyl : (n.) A hypothetical hydrocarbon radical, C3H5, isomeric with allyl and glyceryl, and regarded as the essential residue of glycerin. Cf. Allyl, and Glyceryl.
protocol : (n.) The original copy of any writing, as of a deed, treaty, dispatch, or other instrument. | : (n.) The minutes, or rough draught, of an instrument or transaction. | : (n.) A preliminary document upon the basis of which negotiations are carried on. | : (n.) A convention not formally ratified. | : (n.) An agreement of diplomatists indicating the results reached by them at a particular stage of a negotiation. | : (v. t.) To make a protocol of. | : (v. i.) To make or write protocols, or first draughts; to issue protocols.
pallium : (n.) A large, square, woolen cloak which enveloped the whole person, worn by the Greeks and by certain Romans. It is the Roman name of a Greek garment. | : (n.) A band of white wool, worn on the shoulders, with four purple crosses worked on it; a pall. | : (n.) The mantle of a bivalve. See Mantle. | : (n.) The mantle of a bird.
provoke : (v. t.) To call forth; to call into being or action; esp., to incense to action, a faculty or passion, as love, hate, or ambition; hence, commonly, to incite, as a person, to action by a challenge, by taunts, or by defiance; to exasperate; to irritate; to offend intolerably; to cause to retaliate. | : (v. i.) To cause provocation or anger. | : (v. i.) To appeal. [A Latinism]
