plaited : (imp. & p. p.) of Plait | : (a.) Folded; doubled over; braided; figuratively, involved; intricate; artful.
pulmonary : (a.) Of or pertaining to the lungs; affecting the lungs; pulmonic. | : (a.) Lungwort.
portrait : (n.) The likeness of a person, painted, drawn, or engraved; commonly, a representation of the human face painted from real life. | : (n.) Hence, any graphic or vivid delineation or description of a person; as, a portrait in words. | : (v. t.) To portray; to draw.
poriform : (a.) Resembling a pore, or small puncture.
prolog : (n. & v.) Prologue.
phalarope : (n.) Any species of Phalaropus and allied genera of small wading birds (Grallae), having lobate toes. They are often seen far from land, swimming in large flocks. Called also sea goose.
plaiter : (n.) One who, or that which, plaits.
purse-proud : (a.) Affected with purse pride; puffed up with the possession of riches.
prioress : (n.) A lady superior of a priory of nuns, and next in dignity to an abbess.
pinnacle : (n.) An architectural member, upright, and generally ending in a small spire, -- used to finish a buttress, to constitute a part in a proportion, as where pinnacles flank a gable or spire, and the like. Pinnacles may be considered primarily as added weight, where it is necessary to resist the thrust of an arch, etc. | : (n.) Anything resembling a pinnacle; a lofty peak; a pointed summit. | : (v. t.) To build or furnish with a pinnacle or pinnacles.
proteroglypha : (n. pl.) A suborder of serpents including those that have permanently erect grooved poison fangs, with ordinary teeth behind them in the jaws. It includes the cobras, the asps, and the sea snakes. Called also Proteroglyphia.
polychrest : (n.) A medicine that serves for many uses, or that cures many diseases.
philosophate : (v. i.) To play the philosopher; to moralize.
podogynium : (n.) Same as Basigynium
purposely : (adv.) With purpose or design; intentionally; with predetermination; designedly.
pernicity : (n.) Swiftness; celerity.
puseyistic : (a.) Alt. of Puseyite
placard : (n.) A public proclamation; a manifesto or edict issued by authority. | : (n.) Permission given by authority; a license; as, to give a placard to do something. | : (n.) A written or printed paper, as an advertisement or a declaration, posted, or to be posted, in a public place; a poster. | : (n.) An extra plate on the lower part of the breastplate or backplate. | : (n.) A kind of stomacher, often adorned with jewels, worn in the fifteenth century and later. | : (v. t.) To post placards upon or within; as, to placard a wall, to placard the city. | : (v. t.) To announce by placards; as, to placard a sale.
pocket : (n.) A bag or pouch; especially; a small bag inserted in a garment for carrying small articles, particularly money; hence, figuratively, money; wealth. | : (n.) One of several bags attached to a billiard table, into which the balls are driven. | : (n.) A large bag or sack used in packing various articles, as ginger, hops, cowries, etc. | : (n.) A hole or space covered by a movable piece of board, as in a floor, boxing, partitions, or the like. | : (n.) A cavity in a rock containing a nugget of gold, or other mineral; a small body of ore contained in such a cavity. | : (n.) A hole containing water. | : (n.) A strip of canvas, sewn upon a sail so that a batten or a light spar can placed in the interspace. | : (n.) Same as Pouch. | : (v. t.) To put, or conceal, in the pocket; as, to pocket the change. | : (v. t.) To take clandestinely or fraudulently.
presciently : (adv.) With prescience or foresight.
papistical : (a.) Of or pertaining to the Church of Rome and its doctrines and ceremonies; pertaining to popery; popish; -- used disparagingly.
parenesis : (n.) Exhortation.
polycotyledonary : (a.) Having the villi of the placenta collected into definite patches, or cotyledons.
polariscope : (n.) An instrument consisting essentially of a polarizer and an analyzer, used for polarizing light, and analyzing its properties.
pediform : (a.) Shaped like a foot.
prelusive : (a.) Of the nature of a prelude; introductory; indicating that something of a like kind is to follow.
polariscopy : (n.) The art or rocess of making observations with the polariscope.
principling : (p. pr. & vb. n.) of Principle
paleography : (n.) An ancient manner of writing; ancient writings, collectively; as, Punic paleography. | : (n.) The study of ancient inscriptions and modes of writing; the art or science of deciphering ancient writings, and determining their origin, period, etc., from external characters; diplomatics.
palestinian : (a.) Alt. of Palestinean
perispheric : (a.) Alt. of Perispherical
portoir : (n.) One who, or that which, bears; hence, one who, or that which, produces.
precursor : (n.) One who, or that which, precedes an event, and indicates its approach; a forerunner; a harbinger.
phyllopod : (n.) One of the Phyllopoda. [Also used adjectively.]
pyloric : (a.) Of, pertaining to, or in the region of, the pylorus; as, the pyloric end of the stomach.
polyanthuses : (pl. ) of Polyanthus
powdry : (a.) See Powdery.
phyton : (n.) One of the parts which by their repetition make up a flowering plant, each being a single joint of a stem with its leaf or leaves; a phytomer.
paradoxides : (n.) A genus of large trilobites characteristic of the primordial formations.
philotechnical : (a.) Fond of the arts.
probational : (a.) Probationary.
preened : (imp. & p. p.) of Preen
prescind : (v. t.) To cut off; to abstract. | : (v. t.) To consider by a separate act of attention or analysis.
picnic : (v.) Formerly, an entertainment at which each person contributed some dish to a common table; now, an excursion or pleasure party in which the members partake of a collation or repast (usually in the open air, and from food carried by themselves). | : (v. i.) To go on a picnic, or pleasure excursion; to eat in public fashion.
presidentship : (n.) The office and dignity of president; presidency.
purrock : (n.) See Puddock, and Parrock.
photographist : (n.) A photographer.
physiolatry : (n.) The worship of the powers or agencies of nature; materialism in religion; nature worship.
pererration : (n.) A wandering, or rambling, through various places.
photometrician : (n.) One engaged in the scientific measurement of light.
probationship : (n.) A state of probation.
paddlefish : (n.) A large ganoid fish (Polyodon spathula) found in the rivers of the Mississippi Valley. It has a long spatula-shaped snout. Called also duck-billed cat, and spoonbill sturgeon.
paralactic : (a.) Designating an acid called paralactic acid. See Lactic acid, under Lactic.
polystome : (a.) Having many mouths. | : (n.) An animal having many mouths; -- applied to Protozoa.
pyramidion : (n.) The small pyramid which crowns or completes an obelisk.
pertused : (a.) Punched; pierced with, or having, holes.
puerilely : (adv.) In a puerile manner; childishly.
prandial : (a.) Of or pertaining to a repast, especially to dinner.
psychogenesis : (n.) Genesis through an internal force, as opposed to natural selection.
prolix : (a.) Extending to a great length; unnecessarily long; minute in narration or argument; excessively particular in detail; -- rarely used except with reference to discourse written or spoken; as, a prolix oration; a prolix poem; a prolix sermon. | : (a.) Indulging in protracted discourse; tedious; wearisome; -- applied to a speaker or writer.
polewig : (n.) The European spotted goby (Gobius minutus); -- called also pollybait.
philologue : (n.) A philologist.
presignified : (imp. & p. p.) of Presignify
promerit : (v. t.) To oblige; to confer a favor on. | : (v. t.) To deserve; to procure by merit.
particularly : (adv.) In a particular manner; expressly; with a specific reference or interest; in particular; distinctly. | : (adv.) In an especial manner; in a high degree; as, a particularly fortunate man; a particularly bad failure.
potlid : (n.) The lid or cover of a pot.
piggeries : (pl. ) of Piggery
paque : (n.) See Pasch and Easter.
polyporus : (n.) A genus of fungi having the under surface full of minute pores; also, any fungus of this genus.
physostigmine : (n.) An alkaloid found in the Calabar bean (the seed of Physostigma venenosum), and extracted as a white, tasteless, substance, amorphous or crystalline; -- formerly called eserine, with which it was regarded as identical.
polyedron : (n.) See Polyhedron.
pacific : (a.) Of or pertaining to peace; suited to make or restore peace; of a peaceful character; not warlike; not quarrelsome; conciliatory; as, pacific words or acts; a pacific nature or condition.
paragogical : (a.) Of, pertaining to, or constituting, a paragoge; added to the end of, or serving to lengthen, a word.
posies : (pl. ) of Posy
pivotal : (a.) Of or pertaining to a pivot or turning point; belonging to, or constituting, a pivot; of the nature of a pivot; as, the pivotalopportunity of a career; the pivotal position in a battle.
plesance : (n.) Pleasance.
porgies : (pl. ) of Porgy
phillipsite : (n.) A hydrous silicate of aluminia, lime, and soda, a zeolitic mineral commonly occurring in complex twin crystals, often cruciform in shape; -- called also christianite.
phycomater : (n.) A gelatin in which the algae spores have been supposed to vegetate.
portraitist : (n.) A portrait painter.
prophesying : (p. pr. & vb. n.) of Prophesy
practicability : (n.) The quality or state of being practicable; practicableness; feasibility.
pleasured : (imp. & p. p.) of Pleasure
pluripartite : (a.) Deeply divided into several portions.
possibilities : (pl. ) of Possibility
prefixed : (imp. & p. p.) of Prefix
prostatic : (a.) Of or pertaining to the prostate gland.
phraseologic : (a.) Alt. of Phraseological
pseudomorph : (n.) An irregular or deceptive form. | : (n.) A pseudomorphous crystal, as a crystal consisting of quartz, but having the cubic form of fluor spar, the fluor crystal having been changed to quartz by a process of substitution.
porcelanite : (n.) A semivitrified clay or shale, somewhat resembling jasper; -- called also porcelain jasper.
parapet : (n.) A low wall, especially one serving to protect the edge of a platform, roof, bridge, or the like. | : (n.) A wall, rampart, or elevation of earth, for covering soldiers from an enemy's fire; a breastwork. See Illust. of Casemate.
pantofle : (n.) A slipper for the foot.
plugging : (p. pr. & vb. n.) of Plug | : (n.) The act of stopping with a plug. | : (n.) The material of which a plug or stopple is made.
polyplastic : (a.) Assuming, or having the power of assuming, many forms; as, a polyplastic element which does not preserve its original shape.
pleuroperitoneal : (a.) Of or pertaining to the pleural and peritoneal membranes or cavities, or to the pleuroperitoneum.
palisaded : (imp. & p. p.) of Palisade
preconceive : (v. t.) To conceive, or form an opinion of, beforehand; to form a previous notion or idea of.
preventable : (a.) Capable of being prevented or hindered; as, preventable diseases.
paraglobulin : (n.) An albuminous body in blood serum, belonging to the group of globulins. See Fibrinoplastin.
perturbative : (a.) Tending to cause perturbation; disturbing.
plectrum : (n.) A small instrument of ivory, wood, metal, or quill, used in playing upon the lyre and other stringed instruments.
preconformity : (n.) Anticipative or antecedent conformity.
photographing : (p. pr. & vb. n.) of Photograph
pebbly : (a.) Full of pebbles; pebbled.
perspiration : (n.) The act or process of perspiring. | : (n.) That which is excreted through the skin; sweat.
postremogeniture : (n.) The right of the youngest born.
praezygapophysis : (n.) Same as Prezygapophysis.
petrology : (n.) The department of science which is concerned with the mineralogical and chemical composition of rocks, and with their classification: lithology. | : (n.) A treatise on petrology.
postilling : ( ) of Postil
physiologist : (n.) One who is versed in the science of physiology; a student of the properties and functions of animal and vegetable organs and tissues.
phytotomy : (n.) The dissection of plants; vegetable anatomy.
peakish : (a.) Of or relating to a peak; or to peaks; belonging to a mountainous region. | : (a.) Having peaks; peaked. | : (a.) Having features thin or sharp, as from sickness; hence, sickly.
peroxidize : (v. t.) To oxidize to the utmost degree, so as to form a peroxide.
pelisse : (n.) An outer garment for men or women, originally of fur, or lined with fur; a lady's outer garment, made of silk or other fabric.
pernicion : (n.) Destruction; perdition.
parisienne : (n.) A female native or resident of Paris.
poonac : (n.) A kind of oil cake prepared from the cocoanut. See Oil cake, under Cake.
pleasurer : (n.) A pleasure seeker.
periecians : (n. pl.) See Perioecians.
phonetization : (n.) The act, art, or process of representing sounds by phonetic signs.
patrociny : (n.) See Patrocination.
potashes : (n. pl.) Potash.
palisading : (p. pr. & vb. n.) of Palisade | : (n.) A row of palisades set in the ground.
phenicious : (a.) Of a red color with a slight mixture of gray.
phene : (n.) Benzene.
portioned : (imp. & p. p.) of Portion
procrastinate : (v. t.) To put off till to-morrow, or from day to day; to defer; to postpone; to delay; as, to procrastinate repentance. | : (v. i.) To delay; to be dilatory.
potentizing : (p. pr. & vb. n.) of Potentize
prosencephalon : (n.) The anterior segment of the brain, including the cerebrum and olfactory lobes; the forebrain. | : (n.) The cerebrum.
personate : (v. t.) To celebrate loudly; to extol; to praise. | : (v. t.) To assume the character of; to represent by a fictitious appearance; to act the part of; hence, to counterfeit; to feign; as, he tried to personate his brother; a personated devotion. | : (v. t.) To set forth in an unreal character; to disguise; to mask. | : (v. t.) To personify; to typify; to describe. | : (v. i.) To play or assume a character. | : (a.) Having the throat of a bilabiate corolla nearly closed by a projection of the base of the lower lip; masked, as in the flower of the snapdragon.
ploughbote : (n.) Wood or timber allowed to a tenant for the repair of instruments of husbandry. See Bote.
prolocutor : (n.) One who speaks for another. | : (n.) The presiding officer of a convocation.
pestilation : (n.) The act of pounding and bruising with a pestle in a mortar.
policies : (pl. ) of Policy
precessor : (n.) A predecessor.
panoply : (n.) Defensive armor in general; a full suit of defensive armor.
perused : (imp. & p. p.) of Peruse
pipping : (p. pr. & vb. n.) of Pip
phenogamous : (a.) Same as Phaenogamian, Phaenogamic, etc.
publicness : (n.) The quality or state of being public, or open to the view or notice of people at large; publicity; notoriety; as, the publicness of a sale. | : (n.) The quality or state of belonging to the community; as, the publicness of property.
poulterer : (n.) One who deals in poultry.
polariscopic : (a.) Of or pertaining to the polariscope; obtained by the use of a polariscope; as, polariscopic observations.
pediculus : (n.) A genus of wingless parasitic Hemiptera, including the common lice of man. See Louse.
portioner : (n.) One who portions. | : (n.) See Portionist, 2.
pursue : (v. t.) To follow with a view to overtake; to follow eagerly, or with haste; to chase; as, to pursue a hare. | : (v. t.) To seek; to use or adopt measures to obtain; as, to pursue a remedy at law. | : (v. t.) To proceed along, with a view to some and or object; to follow; to go in; as, Captain Cook pursued a new route; the administration pursued a wise course. | : (v. t.) To prosecute; to be engaged in; to continue. | : (v. t.) To follow as an example; to imitate. | : (v. t.) To follow with enmity; to persecute; to call to account. | : (v. i.) To go in pursuit; to follow. | : (v. i.) To go on; to proceed, especially in argument or discourse; to continue. | : (v. i.) To follow a matter judicially, as a complaining party; to act as a prosecutor.
pouch-mouthed : (a.) Having a pouch mouth; blobber-lipped.
piscary : (n.) The right or privilege of fishing in another man's waters.
psychrometry : (n.) Hygrometry.
primogeniture : (a.) The state of being the firstborn of the same parents; seniority by birth among children of the same family. | : (a.) The exclusive right of inheritance which belongs to the eldest son. Thus in England the right of inheriting the estate of the father belongs to the eldest son, and in the royal family the eldest son of the sovereign is entitled to the throne by primogeniture. In exceptional cases, among the female children, the crown descends by right of primogeniture to the eldest daughter only and her issue.
proleg : (n.) One of the fleshy legs found on the abdominal segments of the larvae of Lepidoptera, sawflies, and some other insects. Those of Lepidoptera have a circle of hooks. Called also proped, propleg, and falseleg.
policied : (a.) Policed. | : (imp. & p. p.) of Policy
poaching : (p. pr. & vb. n.) of Poach
pocketful : (n.) As much as a pocket will hold; enough to fill a pocket; as, pocketfuls of chestnuts.
precogitate : (v. t.) To cogitate beforehand.
personalizing : (p. pr. & vb. n.) of Personalize
performing : (p. pr. & vb. n.) of Perform
perissodactyl : (n.) One of the Perissodactyla.
phyllotaxy : (n.) Alt. of Phyllotaxis
prefatorily : (adv.) In a prefatory manner; by way of preface.
prompture : (a.) Suggestion; incitement; prompting.
pebble : (n.) A small roundish stone or bowlder; especially, a stone worn and rounded by the action of water; a pebblestone. | : (n.) Transparent and colorless rock crystal; as, Brazilian pebble; -- so called by opticians. | : (v. t.) To grain (leather) so as to produce a surface covered with small rounded prominences.
post-disseizor : (n.) A person who disseizes another of lands which the disseizee had before recovered of the same disseizor.
peruser : (n.) One who peruses.
palfrey : (n.) A saddle horse for the road, or for state occasions, as distinguished from a war horse. | : (n.) A small saddle horse for ladies.
polonese : (a. & n.) See Polonaise.
pretibial : (a.) Situated in front of the tibia.
pleasureless : (a.) Devoid of pleasure.
petalum : (n.) A petal.
proscribe : (v. t.) To doom to destruction; to put out of the protection of law; to outlaw; to exile; as, Sylla and Marius proscribed each other's adherents. | : (v. t.) To denounce and condemn; to interdict; to prohibit; as, the Puritans proscribed theaters.
palmitone : (n.) The ketone of palmitic acid.
penknife : (n.) A small pocketknife; formerly, a knife used for making and mending quill pens.
polemy : (n.) Warfare; war; hence, contention; opposition.
podalgia : (n.) pain in the foot, due to gout, rheumatism, etc.
pulvillo : (n.) A kind of perfume in the form of a powder, formerly much used, -- often in little bags.
potmen : (pl. ) of Potman
provencial : (a.) Of or pertaining to Provence in France.
planetoidal : (a.) Pertaining to a planetoid.
pulvilli : (pl. ) of Pulvillus
provect : (a.) Carried forward; advanced.
phrenomagnetism : (n.) The power of exciting the organs of the brain by magnetic or mesmeric influence.
phthiriasis : (n.) A disease (morbus pediculous) consisting in the excessive multiplication of lice on the human body.
philosophistic : (a.) Alt. of Philosophistical
proruption : (n.) The act or state of bursting forth; a bursting out.
peeled : (imp. & p. p.) of Peel
prame : (n.) See Praam.
pigment : (n.) Any material from which a dye, a paint, or the like, may be prepared; particularly, the refined and purified coloring matter ready for mixing with an appropriate vehicle. | : (n.) Any one of the colored substances found in animal and vegetable tissues and fluids, as bilirubin, urobilin, chlorophyll, etc. | : (n.) Wine flavored with species and honey.
prosodian : (n.) A prosodist.
pleaching : (p. pr. & vb. n.) of Pleach
prosodial : (a.) Prosodical.
perimysial : (a.) Surrounding a muscle or muscles. | : (a.) Of or pertaining to the perimysium.
posttertiary : (a.) Following, or more recent than, the Tertiary; Quaternary.
panorpian : (a.) Like, or pertaining to, the genus Panorpa. | : (n.) Same as Panorpid.
perrie : (n.) Precious stones; jewels.
pooling : (p. pr. & vb. n.) of Pool | : (n.) The act of uniting, or an agreement to unite, an aggregation of properties belonging to different persons, with a view to common liabilities or profits.
pearlaceous : (a.) Resembling pearl or mother-of-pearl; pearly in quality or appearance.
photochemistry : (n.) The branch of chemistry which relates to the effect of light in producing chemical changes, as in photography.
partialist : (n.) One who is partial. | : (n.) One who holds that the atonement was made only for a part of mankind, that is, for the elect.
pedial : (a.) Pertaining to the foot, or to any organ called a foot; pedal.
peeress : (n.) The wife of a peer; a woman ennobled in her own right, or by right of marriage.
partialism : (n.) Partiality; specifically (Theol.), the doctrine of the Partialists.
paries : (n.) The triangular middle part of each segment of the shell of a barnacle.
prepensely : (adv.) In a premeditated manner.
pendicle : (n.) An appendage; something dependent on another; an appurtenance; a pendant.
prehnite : (n.) A pale green mineral occurring in crystalline aggregates having a botryoidal or mammillary structure, and rarely in distinct crystals. It is a hydrous silicate of alumina and lime.
paralipomenon : (n. pl.) A title given in the Douay Bible to the Books of Chronicles.
porpesse : (n.) A porpoise.
privateersmen : (pl. ) of Privateersman
petitor : (n.) One who seeks or asks; a seeker; an applicant.
protectoral : (a.) Of or pertaining to a protector; protectorial; as, protectoral power.
petrological : (a.) Of or pertaining to petrology.
pestering : (p. pr. & vb. n.) of Pester
platycoelian : (a.) Flat at the anterior and concave at the posterior end; -- said of the centra of the vertebrae of some extinct dinouaurs.
photomechanical : (a.) Pertaining to, or designating, any photographic process in which a printing surface is obtained without the intervention of hand engraving.
pollarded : (imp. & p. p.) of Pollard
pauhaugen : (n.) The menhaden; -- called also poghaden.
podophyllous : (a.) Having thin, flat, leaflike locomotive organs. | : (a.) Pertaining to, or composing, the layer of tissue, made up of laminae, beneath a horse's hoof.
pitchstone : (n.) An igneous rock of semiglassy nature, having a luster like pitch.
pedregal : (n.) A lava field.
pharisaism : (n.) The notions, doctrines, and conduct of the Pharisees, as a sect. | : (n.) Rigid observance of external forms of religion, without genuine piety; hypocrisy in religion; a censorious, self-righteous spirit in matters of morals or manners.
prunus : (n.) A genus of trees with perigynous rosaceous flowers, and a single two-ovuled carpel which usually becomes a drupe in ripening.
pluming : (p. pr. & vb. n.) of Plume
percaline : (n.) A fine kind of French cotton goods, usually of one color.
phloem : (n.) That portion of fibrovascular bundles which corresponds to the inner bark; the liber tissue; -- distinguished from xylem.
perpetrable : (a.) Capable of being perpetrated.
polyzoan : (n.) Any species of Polyzoa; one of the Polyzoa. | : (n.) A polyzoon.
pistacia : (n.) The name of a genus of trees, including the tree which bears the pistachio, the Mediterranean mastic tree (Pistacia Lentiscus), and the species (P. Terebinthus) which yields Chian or Cyprus turpentine.
psychrometer : (n.) An instrument for measuring the tension of the aqueous vapor in the atmosphere, being essentially a wet and dry bulb hygrometer.
passiontide : (n.) The last fortnight of Lent.
persuasible : (a.) Capable of being persuaded; persuadable. | : (a.) Persuasive.
peccability : (n.) The state or quality of being peccable; lability to sin.
pentacapsular : (a.) Having five capsules.
pseudopodium : (n.) Same as Pseudopod.
pachyglossal : (a.) Having a thick tongue; -- applied to a group of lizards (Pachyglossae), including the iguanas and agamas.
powerless : (a.) Destitute of power, force, or energy; weak; impotent; not able to produce any effect.
perusal : (n.) The act of carefully viewing or examining. | : (n.) The act of reading, especially of reading through or with care.
purfling : (n.) Ornamentation on the border of a thing; specifically, the inlaid border of a musical instrument, as a violin.
precocity : (n.) The quality or state of being precocious; untimely ripeness; premature development, especially of the mental powers; forwardness.
polyacrons : (pl. ) of Polyacron
precursory : (a.) Preceding as a precursor or harbinger; indicating something to follow; as, precursory symptoms of a fever. | : (n.) An introduction.
pensioned : (imp. & p. p.) of Pension
preface : (n.) Something spoken as introductory to a discourse, or written as introductory to a book or essay; a proem; an introduction, or series of preliminary remarks. | : (n.) The prelude or introduction to the canon of the Mass. | : (v. t.) To introduce by a preface; to give a preface to; as, to preface a book discourse. | : (v. i.) To make a preface.
predominantly : (adv.) In a predominant manner.
prosemination : (n.) Propagation by seed.
proclaimer : (n.) One who proclaims.
promissorily : (adv.) In a promissory manner.
periblem : (n.) Nascent cortex, or immature cellular bark.
perversedly : (adv.) Perversely.
pensioner : (n.) One in receipt of a pension; hence, figuratively, a dependent. | : (n.) One of an honorable band of gentlemen who attend the sovereign of England on state occasions, and receive an annual pension, or allowance, of L150 and two horses. | : (n.) In the university of Cambridge, England, one who pays for his living in commons; -- corresponding to commoner at Oxford.
polychromatic : (a.) Showing a variety, or a change, of colors.
preserved : (imp. & p. p.) of Preserve
proclaimed : (imp. & p. p.) of Proclaim
puncticular : (a.) Comprised in, or like, a point; exact.
passager : (n.) A passenger; a bird or boat of passage.
prophetically : (adv.) In a prophetical manner; by way of prediction.
painterly : (a.) Like a painter's work.
pupation : (n.) the act of becoming a pupa.
prebend : (n.) A payment or stipend; esp., the stipend or maintenance granted to a prebendary out of the estate of a cathedral or collegiate church with which he is connected. See Note under Benefice. | : (n.) A prebendary.
pariah : (n.) One of an aboriginal people of Southern India, regarded by the four castes of the Hindoos as of very low grade. They are usually the serfs of the Sudra agriculturalists. See Caste. | : (n.) An outcast; one despised by society.
permissibility : (n.) The quality of being permissible; permissibleness; allowableness.
pneumonometer : (n.) A spirometer; a pneumometer.
preserver : (n.) One who, or that which, preserves, saves, or defends, from destruction, injury, or decay; esp., one who saves the life or character of another. | : (n.) One who makes preserves of fruit.
paralyzing : (p. pr. & vb. n.) of Paralyze
prodition : (n.) Disclosure; treachery; treason.
pedicellaria : (n.) A peculiar forcepslike organ which occurs in large numbers upon starfishes and echini. Those of starfishes have two movable jaws, or blades, and are usually nearly, or quite, sessile; those of echini usually have three jaws and a pedicel. See Illustration in Appendix.
proostracum : (n.) The anterior prolongation of the guard of the phragmocone of belemnites and allied fossil cephalopods, whether horny or calcareous. See Illust. of Phragmocone.
perspirative : (a.) Performing the act of perspiration; perspiratory.
piketail : (n.) See Pintail, 1.
priestly : (a.) Of or pertaining to a priest or the priesthood; sacerdotal; befitting or becoming a priest; as, the priestly office; a priestly farewell.
prepay : (v. t.) To pay in advance, or beforehand; as, to prepay postage.
pelma : (n.) The under surface of the foot.
pronunciatory : (a.) Of or pertaining to pronunciation; that pronounces.
peroxidation : (n.) Act, process, or result of peroxidizing; oxidation to a peroxide.
peract : (v. t.) To go through with; to perform.
parial : (n.) See Pair royal, under Pair, n.
pneumatometer : (n.) An instrument for measuring the amount of force exerted by the lungs in respiration.
protohippus : (n.) A genus of fossil horses from the Lower Pliocene. They had three toes on each foot, the lateral ones being small.
propionyl : (n.) The hypothetical radical C3H5O, regarded as the essential residue of propionic acid and certain related compounds.
parian : (a.) Of or pertaining to Paros, an island in the Aegean Sea noted for its excellent statuary marble; as, Parian marble. | : (n.) A native or inhabitant of Paros. | : (n.) A ceramic ware, resembling unglazed porcelain biscuit, of which are made statuettes, ornaments, etc.
pileated : (a.) Having the form of a cap for the head. | : (a.) Having a crest covering the pileus, or whole top of the head.
preconize : (v. t.) To approve by preconization.
privateersman : (n.) An officer or seaman of a privateer.
plumbagineous : (a.) Pertaining to natural order (Plumbagineae) of gamopetalous herbs, of which Plumbago is the type. The order includes also the marsh rosemary, the thrift, and a few other genera.
plural : (a.) Relating to, or containing, more than one; designating two or more; as, a plural word. | : (n.) The plural number; that form of a word which expresses or denotes more than one; a word in the plural form.
policing : (p. pr. & vb. n.) of Police
prank : (v. t.) To adorn in a showy manner; to dress or equip ostentatiously; -- often followed by up; as, to prank up the body. See Prink. | : (v. i.) To make ostentatious show. | : (n.) A gay or sportive action; a ludicrous, merry, or mischievous trick; a caper; a frolic. | : (a.) Full of gambols or tricks.
physique : (n.) The natural constitution, or physical structure, of a person.
papboat : (n.) A kind of sauce boat or dish. | : (n.) A large spiral East Indian marine shell (Turbinella rapha); -- so called because used by native priests to hold the oil for anointing.
permanable : (a.) Permanent; durable.
pandarism : (n.) Same as Panderism.
philologic : (a.) Of or pertaining to philology.
postscutellum : (n.) The hindermost dorsal piece of a thoracic somite of an insect; the plate behind the scutellum.
premaxillae : (pl. ) of Premaxilla
partiality : (n.) The quality or state of being partial; inclination to favor one party, or one side of a question, more than the other; undue bias of mind. | : (n.) A predilection or inclination to one thing rather than to others; special taste or liking; as, a partiality for poetry or painting.
parturious : (a.) Parturient.
proscriptionist : (n.) One who proscribes.
pinnock : (n.) The hedge sparrow. | : (n.) The tomtit.
protococcus : (n.) A genus of minute unicellular algae including the red snow plant (Protococcus nivalis).
preacquaint : (v. t.) To acquaint previously or beforehand.
paleola : (n.) A diminutive or secondary palea; a lodicule.
pantophagous : (a.) Eating all kinds of food.
productible : (a.) Capable of being produced; producible.
palatal : (a.) Of or pertaining to the palate; palatine; as, the palatal bones. | : (a.) Uttered by the aid of the palate; -- said of certain sounds, as the sound of k in kirk. | : (n.) A sound uttered, or a letter pronounced, by the aid of the palate, as the letters k and y.
psychism : (n.) The doctrine of Quesne, that there is a fluid universally diffused, end equally animating all living beings, the difference in their actions being due to the difference of the individual organizations.
paralepsis : (n.) See Paraleipsis.
pollinium : (n.) A coherent mass of pollen, as in the milkweed and most orchids.
pygopod : (n.) One of the Pygopodes. | : (n.) Any species of serpentiform lizards of the family Pygopodidae, which have rudimentary hind legs near the anal cleft, but lack fore legs.
pseudovaries : (pl. ) of Pseudovary
panurgy : (n.) Skill in all kinds of work or business; craft.
prepossessed : (imp. & p. p.) of Prepossess
pectinal : (a.) Of or pertaining to a comb; resembling a comb. | : (n.) A fish whose bone/ resemble comb teeth.
pantomimic : (a.) Alt. of Pantomimical
phraseogram : (n.) A symbol for a phrase.
proselytizing : (p. pr. & vb. n.) of Proselytize
pinakothek : (n.) Pinacotheca.
photogram : (n.) A photograph.
pickaninny : (n.) A small child; especially, a negro or mulatto infant.
patois : (n.) A dialect peculiar to the illiterate classes; a provincial form of speech.
ponderance : (n.) Weight; gravity.
postliminiary : (a.) Pertaining to, or involving, the right of postliminium.
philosophe : (n.) A philosophaster; a philosopher.
posthetomy : (n.) Circumcision.
polynucleolar : (a.) Having more than one nucleolus.
pinchingly : (adv.) In a pinching way.
perivitelline : (a.) Situated around the vitellus, or between the vitellus and zona pellucida of an ovum.
provokable : (a.) That may be provoked.
presbyteress : (n.) A female presbyter.
pollenin : (n.) A substance found in the pollen of certain plants.
paring : (p. pr. & vb. n.) of Pare | : (v. t.) The act of cutting off the surface or extremites of anything. | : (v. t.) That which is pared off.
pluviameter : (n.) See Pluviometer.
presupposal : (n.) Presupposition.
puzzle-headed : (a.) Having the head full of confused notions.
prate : (v. i.) To talk much and to little purpose; to be loquacious; to speak foolishly; to babble. | : (v. t.) To utter foolishly; to speak without reason or purpose; to chatter, or babble. | : (n.) Talk to little purpose; trifling talk; unmeaning loquacity.
productibility : (n.) The state of being productible; producibility.
picapare : (n.) The finfoot.
plinth : (n.) In classical architecture, a vertically faced member immediately below the circular base of a column; also, the lowest member of a pedestal; hence, in general, the lowest member of a base; a sub-base; a block upon which the moldings of an architrave or trim are stopped at the bottom. See Illust. of Column.
pettifogging : (p. pr. & vb. n.) of Pettifog | : (a.) Paltry; quibbling; mean. | : (n.) Pettifoggery.
pestiferously : (adv.) In a pestiferuos manner.
probabilities : (pl. ) of Probability
peritoneal : (a.) Of or pertaining to the peritoneum.
phellogen : (n.) The tissue of young cells which produces cork cells.
pagina : (n.) The surface of a leaf or of a flattened thallus.
platitudinize : (v. i.) To utter platitudes or truisms.
pyrotechnician : (n.) A pyrotechnist.
pretentative : (a.) Fitted for trial beforehand; experimental.
plowing : (p. pr. & vb. n.) of Plough
paging : (p. pr. & vb. n.) of Page | : (n.) The marking or numbering of the pages of a book.
philosophy : (n.) Literally, the love of, including the search after, wisdom; in actual usage, the knowledge of phenomena as explained by, and resolved into, causes and reasons, powers and laws. | : (n.) A particular philosophical system or theory; the hypothesis by which particular phenomena are explained. | : (n.) Practical wisdom; calmness of temper and judgment; equanimity; fortitude; stoicism; as, to meet misfortune with philosophy. | : (n.) Reasoning; argumentation. | : (n.) The course of sciences read in the schools. | : (n.) A treatise on philosophy.
prepossessor : (n.) One who possesses, or occupies, previously.
prochein : (a.) Next; nearest.
phaseless : (a.) Without a phase, or visible form.
phytologist : (n.) One skilled in phytology; a writer on plants; a botanist.
pungent : (v. t.) Causing a sharp sensation, as of the taste, smell, or feelings; pricking; biting; acrid; as, a pungent spice. | : (v. t.) Sharply painful; penetrating; poignant; severe; caustic; stinging. | : (v. t.) Prickly-pointed; hard and sharp.
perfunctory : (a.) Done merely to get rid of a duty; performed mechanically and as a thing of rote; done in a careless and superficial manner; characterized by indifference; as, perfunctory admonitions. | : (a.) Hence: Mechanical; indifferent; listless; careless.
passenger : (n.) A passer or passer-by; a wayfarer. | : (n.) A traveler by some established conveyance, as a coach, steamboat, railroad train, etc.
photogalvanography : (n.) The art or process of making photo-electrotypes.
protamin : (n.) An amorphous nitrogenous substance found in the spermatic fluid of salmon. It is soluble in water, which an alkaline reaction, and unites with acids and metallic bases.
poynder : (n.) See Poind, Poinder.
pteropoda : (n. pl.) A class of Mollusca in which the anterior lobes of the foot are developed in the form of broad, thin, winglike organs, with which they swim at near the surface of the sea.
philanthropinist : (n.) An advocate of, or believer in, philanthropinism.
prefatorial : (a.) Prefatory.
perceivable : (a.) Capable of being perceived; perceptible.
pornographic : (a.) Of or pertaining to pornography; lascivious; licentious; as, pornographic writing.
philologer : (n.) A philologist.
premotion : (n.) Previous motion or excitement to action.
philanthropinism : (n.) A system of education on so-called natural principles, attempted in Germany in the last century by Basedow, of Dessau.
phanerogamic : (a.) Alt. of Phanerogamous
palacious : (a.) Palatial.
personage : (n.) Form, appearance, or belongings of a person; the external appearance, stature, figure, air, and the like, of a person. | : (n.) Character assumed or represented. | : (n.) A notable or distinguished person; a conspicious or peculiar character; as, an illustrious personage; a comely personage of stature tall.
phanerogamia : (n. pl.) That one of the two primary divisions of the vegetable kingdom which contains the phanerogamic, or flowering, plants.
polyhalite : (n.) A mineral usually occurring in fibrous masses, of a brick-red color, being tinged with iron, and consisting chiefly of the sulphates of lime, magnesia, and soda.
phylacteric : (a.) Alt. of Phylacterical
puberulent : (a.) Very minutely downy.
pokerish : (a.) Infested by pokers; adapted to excite fear; as, a pokerish place. | : (a.) Stiff like a poker.
prasoid : (a.) Resembling prase.
presentimental : (a.) Of nature of a presentiment; foreboding.
perdulous : (a.) Lost; thrown away.
phenanthridine : (n.) A nitrogenous hydrocarbon base, C13H9N, analogous to phenanthrene and quinoline.
pourparler : (n.) A consultation preliminary to a treaty.
preponderancy : (n.) The quality or state of being preponderant; superiority or excess of weight, influence, or power, etc.; an outweighing. | : (n.) The excess of weight of that part of a canon behind the trunnions over that in front of them.
paracentrical : (a.) Deviating from circularity; changing the distance from a center.
profligate : (a.) Overthrown; beaten; conquered. | : (a.) Broken down in respect of rectitude, principle, virtue, or decency; openly and shamelessly immoral or vicious; dissolute; as, profligate man or wretch. | : (n.) An abandoned person; one openly and shamelessly vicious; a dissolute person. | : (v. t.) To drive away; to overcome.
preponderance : (n.) Alt. of Preponderancy
platinotype : (n.) A permanent photographic picture or print in platinum black. | : (n.) The process by which such pictures are produced.
paraxial : (a.) On either side of the axis of the skeleton.
platyelminthes : (n. pl.) A class of helminthes including the cestodes, or tapeworms, the trematodes, and the turbellarians. Called also flatworms.
prase : (n.) A variety of cryptocrystalline of a leek-green color.
pannel : (n.) A kind of rustic saddle. | : (n.) The stomach of a hawk. | : (n.) A carriage for conveying a mortar and its bed, on a march.
picromel : (n.) A colorless viscous substance having a bitter-sweet taste.
proximad : (adv.) Toward a proximal part; on the proximal side of; proximally.
pettywhin : (n.) The needle furze. See under Needle.
panned : (imp. & p. p.) of Pan
peplis : (n.) A genus of plants including water purslane.
potsdam group : ( ) A subdivision of the Primordial or Cambrian period in American geology; -- so named from the sandstone of Potsdam, New York. See Chart of Geology.
proximal : (a.) Toward or nearest, as to a body, or center of motion of dependence; proximate. | : (a.) Situated near the point of attachment or origin; as, the proximal part of a limb. | : (a.) Of or pertaining to that which is proximal; as, the proximal bones of a limb. Opposed to distal.
poikilitic : (a.) See Poecilitic.
papaveraceous : (a.) Of, pertaining to, or resembling, a natural order of plants (Papaveraceae) of which the poppy, the celandine, and the bloodroot are well-known examples.
phonotypy : (n.) A method of phonetic printing of the English language, as devised by Mr. Pitman, in which nearly all the ordinary letters and many new forms are employed in order to indicate each elementary sound by a separate character.
polyonym : (n.) An object which has a variety of names. | : (n.) A polynomial name or term.
pyrenean : (a.) Of or pertaining to the Pyrenees, a range of mountains separating France and Spain. | : (n.) The Pyrenees.
paleous : (a.) Chaffy; like chaff; paleaceous.
pollened : (a.) Covered with pollen.
powderhorn : (n.) A horn in which gunpowder is carried.
pyritous : (a.) Pyritic.
photochemical : (a.) Of or pertaining to chemical action of light, or produced by it; as, the photochemical changes of the visual purple of the retina.
perspire : (v. i.) To excrete matter through the skin; esp., to excrete fluids through the pores of the skin; to sweat. | : (v. i.) To be evacuated or excreted, or to exude, through the pores of the skin; as, a fluid perspires. | : (v. t.) To emit or evacuate through the pores of the skin; to sweat; to excrete through pores.
punctilio : (n.) A nice point of exactness in conduct, ceremony, or proceeding; particularity or exactness in forms; as, the punctilios of a public ceremony.
peremptory : (a.) Precluding debate or expostulation; not admitting of question or appeal; positive; absolute; decisive; conclusive; final. | : (a.) Positive in opinion or judgment; decided; dictatorial; dogmatical. | : (a.) Firmly determined; unawed.
plentevous : (a.) Plenteous.
pistoled : (imp. & p. p.) of Pistol
potman : (n.) A pot companion. | : (n.) A servant in a public house; a potboy.
pruner : (n.) One who prunes, or removes, what is superfluous. | : (n.) Any one of several species of beetles whose larvae gnaw the branches of trees so as to cause them to fall, especially the American oak pruner (Asemum moestum), whose larva eats the pith of oak branches, and when mature gnaws a circular furrow on the inside nearly to the bark. When the branches fall each contains a pupa.
psychomachy : (n.) A conflict of the soul with the body.
playwright : (n.) A maker or adapter of plays.
pigmean : (a.) See Pygmean.
primness : (n.) The quality or state of being prim; affected formality or niceness; preciseness; stiffness.
paintership : (n.) The state or position of being a painter.
prepossess : (v. t.) To preoccupy, as ground or land; to take previous possession of. | : (v. t.) To preoccupy, as the mind or heart, so as to preclude other things; hence, to bias or prejudice; to give a previous inclination to, for or against anything; esp., to induce a favorable opinion beforehand, or at the outset.
pelta : (n.) A small shield, especially one of an approximately elliptic form, or crescent-shaped. | : (n.) A flat apothecium having no rim.
potential : (a.) Being potent; endowed with energy adequate to a result; efficacious; influential. | : (a.) Existing in possibility, not in actuality. | : (n.) Anything that may be possible; a possibility; potentially. | : (n.) In the theory of gravitation, or of other forces acting in space, a function of the rectangular coordinates which determine the position of a point, such that its differential coefficients with respect to the coordinates are equal to the components of the force at the point considered; -- also called potential function, or force function. It is called also Newtonian potential when the force is directed to a fixed center and is inversely as the square of the distance from the center. | : (n.) The energy of an electrical charge measured by its power to do work; hence, the degree of electrification as referred to some standard, as that of the earth; electro-motive force.
prothoracic : (a.) Of or pertaining to the prothorax.
pantography : (n.) A general description; entire view of an object.
privacies : (pl. ) of Privacy
protruded : (imp. & p. p.) of Protrude
psyche : (n.) A lovely maiden, daughter of a king and mistress of Eros, or Cupid. She is regarded as the personification of the soul. | : (n.) The soul; the vital principle; the mind. | : (n.) A cheval glass.
pistolet : (n.) A small pistol.
phylactolema : (n. pl.) Alt. of Phylactolemata
philomusical : (a.) Loving music. [R.]Busby.
pleaded : (imp. & p. p.) of Plead
plagiotremata : (n. pl.) Same as Lepidosauria.
phytological : (a.) Of or pertaining to phytology; botanical.
polyiodide : (n.) A iodide having more than one atom of iodine in the molecule.
panderage : (n.) The act of pandering.
paramiographer : (n.) A collector or writer of proverbs.
pearlings : (n. pl.) A kind of lace of silk or thread.
pervestigate : (v. t.) To investigate thoroughly.
pleader : (n.) One who pleads; one who argues for or against; an advotate. | : (n.) One who draws up or forms pleas; the draughtsman of pleas or pleadings in the widest sense; as, a special pleader.
poisonsome : (a.) Poisonous.[Obs.] Holland.
pneumatics : (n.) That branch of science which treats of the mechanical properties of air and other elastic fluids, as of their weight, pressure, elasticity, etc. See Mechanics. | : (n.) The scientific study or knowledge of spiritual beings and their relations to God, angels, and men.
polypiparous : (a.) Producing polyps.
polygastric : (a.) Having several bellies; -- applied to muscles which are made up of several bellies separated by short tendons. | : (a.) Pertaining to the Polygastrica. | : (n.) One of the Polygastrica.
phylactered : (a.) Wearing a phylactery.
pyrolithic : (a.) Same as Pyrouric, or Cyanuric.
perditionable : (a.) Capable of being ruined; worthy of perdition.
point : (v. t. & i.) To appoint. | : (n.) That which pricks or pierces; the sharp end of anything, esp. the sharp end of a piercing instrument, as a needle or a pin. | : (n.) An instrument which pricks or pierces, as a sort of needle used by engravers, etchers, lace workers, and others; also, a pointed cutting tool, as a stone cutter's point; -- called also pointer. | : (n.) Anything which tapers to a sharp, well-defined termination. Specifically: A small promontory or cape; a tract of land extending into the water beyond the common shore line. | : (n.) The mark made by the end of a sharp, piercing instrument, as a needle; a prick. | : (n.) An indefinitely small space; a mere spot indicated or supposed. Specifically: (Geom.) That which has neither parts nor magnitude; that which has position, but has neither length, breadth, nor thickness, -- sometimes conceived of as the limit of a line; that by the motion of which a line is conceived to be produced. | : (n.) An indivisible portion of time; a moment; an instant; hence, the verge. | : (n.) A mark of punctuation; a character used to mark the divisions of a composition, or the pauses to be observed in reading, or to point off groups of figures, etc.; a stop, as a comma, a semicolon, and esp. a period; hence, figuratively, an end, or conclusion. | : (n.) Whatever serves to mark progress, rank, or relative position, or to indicate a transition from one state or position to another, degree; step; stage; hence, position or condition attained; as, a point of elevation, or of depression; the stock fell off five points; he won by tenpoints. | : (n.) That which arrests attention, or indicates qualities or character; a salient feature; a characteristic; a peculiarity; hence, a particular; an item; a detail; as, the good or bad points of a man, a horse, a book, a story, etc. | : (n.) Hence, the most prominent or important feature, as of an argument, discourse, etc.; the essential matter; esp., the proposition to be established; as, the point of an anecdote. | : (n.) A small matter; a trifle; a least consideration; a punctilio. | : (n.) A dot or mark used to designate certain tones or time | : (n.) A dot or mark distinguishing or characterizing certain tones or styles; as, points of perfection, of augmentation, etc.; hence, a note; a tune. | : (n.) A dot placed at the right hand of a note, to raise its value, or prolong its time, by one half, as to make a whole note equal to three half notes, a half note equal to three quarter notes. | : (n.) A fixed conventional place for reference, or zero of reckoning, in the heavens, usually the intersection of two or more great circles of the sphere, and named specifically in each case according to the position intended; as, the equinoctial points; the solstitial points; the nodal points; vertical points, etc. See Equinoctial Nodal. | : (n.) One of the several different parts of the escutcheon. See Escutcheon. | : (n.) One of the points of the compass (see Points of the compass, below); also, the difference between two points of the compass; as, to fall off a point. | : (n.) A short piece of cordage used in reefing sails. See Reef point, under Reef. | : (n.) A a string or lace used to tie together certain parts of the dress. | : (n.) Lace wrought the needle; as, point de Venise; Brussels point. See Point lace, below. | : (n.) A switch. | : (n.) An item of private information; a hint; a tip; a pointer. | : (n.) A fielder who is stationed on the off side, about twelve or fifteen yards from, and a little in advance of, the batsman. | : (n.) The attitude assumed by a pointer dog when he finds game; as, the dog came to a point. See Pointer. | : (n.) A standard unit of measure for the size of type bodies, being one twelfth of the thickness of pica type. See Point system of type, under Type. | : (n.) A tyne or snag of an antler. | : (n.) One of the spaces on a backgammon board. | : (n.) A movement executed with the saber or foil; as, tierce point. | : (n.) To give a point to; to sharpen; to cut, forge, grind, or file to an acute end; as, to point a dart, or a pencil. Used also figuratively; as, to point a moral. | : (n.) To direct toward an abject; to aim; as, to point a gun at a wolf, or a cannon at a fort. | : (n.) Hence, to direct the attention or notice of. | : (n.) To supply with punctuation marks; to punctuate; as, to point a composition. | : (n.) To mark (as Hebrew) with vowel points. | : (n.) To give particular prominence to; to designate in a special manner; to indicate, as if by pointing; as, the error was pointed out. | : (n.) To indicate or discover by a fixed look, as game. | : (n.) To fill up and finish the joints of (a wall), by introducing additional cement or mortar, and bringing it to a smooth surface. | : (n.) To cut, as a surface, with a pointed tool. | : (v. i.) To direct the point of something, as of a finger, for the purpose of designating an object, and attracting attention to it; -- with at. | : (v. i.) To indicate the presence of game by fixed and steady look, as certain hunting dogs do. | : (v. i.) To approximate to the surface; to head; -- said of an abscess.
polished : (imp. & p. p.) of Polish | : (a.) Made smooth and glossy, as by friction; hence, highly finished; refined; polite; as, polished plate; polished manners; polished verse.
paracentesis : (n.) The perforation of a cavity of the body with a trocar, aspirator, or other suitable instrument, for the evacuation of effused fluid, pus, or gas; tapping.
peeler : (n.) One who peels or strips. | : (n.) A pillager. | : (n.) A nickname for a policeman; -- so called from Sir Robert Peel.
polyadelphous : (a.) Belonging to the class Polyadelphia; having stamens united in three or more bundles.
pratincole : (n.) Any bird of the Old World genus Glareola, or family Glareolidae, allied to the plovers. They have long, pointed wings and a forked tail.
portuguese : (a.) Of or pertaining to Portugal, or its inhabitants. | : (n. sing. & pl.) A native or inhabitant of Portugal; people of Portugal.
poind : (v. t.) To impound, as cattle. | : (v. t.) To distrain.
polisher : (n.) One who, or that which, polishes; also, that which is used in polishing.
propendent : (a.) Inclining forward or toward.
pyrophanous : (a.) Rendered transparent by heat.
papyrean : (a.) Of or pertaining to papyrus, or to paper; papyraceous.
pinnated : (a.) Consisting of several leaflets, or separate portions, arranged on each side of a common petiole, as the leaves of a rosebush, a hickory, or an ash. See Abruptly pinnate, and Illust., under Abruptly. | : (a.) Having a winglike tuft of long feathers on each side of the neck.
prawn : (n.) Any one of numerous species of large shrimplike Crustacea having slender legs and long antennae. They mostly belong to the genera Pandalus, Palaemon, Palaemonetes, and Peneus, and are much used as food. The common English prawn is Palaemon serratus.
preelect : (v. t.) To elect beforehand.
panoplied : (a.) Dressed in panoply.
posting : (p. pr. & vb. n.) of Post | : (n.) The act of traveling post. | : (n.) The act of transferring an account, as from the journal to the ledger.
protectorate : (n.) Government by a protector; -- applied especially to the government of England by Oliver Cromwell. | : (n.) The authority assumed by a superior power over an inferior or a dependent one, whereby the former protects the latter from invasion and shares in the management of its affairs.
prairie : (n.) An extensive tract of level or rolling land, destitute of trees, covered with coarse grass, and usually characterized by a deep, fertile soil. They abound throughout the Mississippi valley, between the Alleghanies and the Rocky mountains. | : (n.) A meadow or tract of grass; especially, a so called natural meadow.
patentable : (a.) Suitable to be patented; capable of being patented.
plagal : (a.) Having a scale running from the dominant to its octave; -- said of certain old church modes or tunes, as opposed to those called authentic, which ran from the tonic to its octave.
promissive : (a.) Making a promise; implying a promise; promising.
palatic : (a.) Palatal; palatine. | : (n.) A palatal.
pedestrial : (a.) Of or pertaining to the feet; employing the foot or feet.
plagae : (pl. ) of Plaga
phonotypr : (n.) A type or character used in phonotypy.
pedestrian : (a.) Going on foot; performed on foot; as, a pedestrian journey. | : (n.) A walker; one who journeys on foot; a foot traveler; specif., a professional walker or runner.
plantocracy : (n.) Government by planters; planters, collectively.
persisted : (imp. & p. p.) of Persist
pseudo-romantic : (a.) Falsely romantic.
pseudobacteria : (n. pl.) Microscopic organic particles, molecular granules, powdered inorganic substances, etc., which in form, size, and grouping resemble bacteria.
pruning : (p. pr. & vb. n.) of Prune | : (n.) The act of trimming, or removing what is superfluous. | : (n.) That which is cast off by bird in pruning her feathers; leavings.
pontifice : (n.) Bridgework; structure or edifice of a bridge.
provection : (n.) A carrying forward, as of a final letter, to a following word; as, for example, a nickname for an ekename.
pupilage : (n.) The state of being a pupil.
perimetric : (a.) Alt. of Perimetrical
pygidium : (n.) The caudal plate of trilobites, crustacean, and certain insects. See Illust. of Limulus and Trilobite.
pinaster : (n.) A species of pine (Pinus Pinaster) growing in Southern Europe.
pentagonous : (a.) Pentagonal.
petaled : (a.) Having petals; as, a petaled flower; -- opposed to apetalous, and much used in compounds; as, one-petaled, three-petaled, etc.
playtime : (n.) Time for play or diversion.
punctist : (n.) A punctator.
paintless : (a.) Not capable of being painted or described.
palmarium : (n.) One of the bifurcations of the brachial plates of a crinoid.
peltate : (a.) Alt. of Peltated
peristerion : (n.) The herb vervain (Verbena officinalis).
pixy-led : (a.) Led by pixies; bewildered.
polyspast : (n.) A machine consisting of many pulleys; specifically, an apparatus formerly used for reducing luxations.
pithily : (adv.) In a pithy manner.
predictable : (a.) That may be predicted.
prevenience : (n.) The act of going before; anticipation.
pomegranate : (n.) The fruit of the tree Punica Granatum; also, the tree itself (see Balaustine), which is native in the Orient, but is successfully cultivated in many warm countries, and as a house plant in colder climates. The fruit is as large as an orange, and has a hard rind containing many rather large seeds, each one separately covered with crimson, acid pulp. | : (n.) A carved or embroidered ornament resembling a pomegranate.
predicating : (p. pr. & vb. n.) of Predicate
paranthracene : (n.) An inert isomeric modification of anthracene.
prosiliency : (n.) The act of leaping forth or forward; projection.
psilanthropic : (a.) Pertaining to, or embodying, psilanthropy. "A psilanthropic explanation."
pituitary : (a.) Secreting mucus or phlegm; as, the pituitary membrane, or the mucous membrane which lines the nasal cavities. | : (a.) Of or pertaining to the pituitary body; as, the pituitary fossa.
palpebra : (n.) The eyelid.
polyhymnia : (n.) The Muse of lyric poetry.
polyzoon : (n.) One of the individual zooids forming the compound organism of a polyzoan.
patrocination : (n.) The act of patrocinating or patronizing.
puerileness : (n.) The quality of being puerile; puerility.
pickery : (n.) Petty theft.
preference : (n.) The act of Preferring, or the state of being preferred; the setting of one thing before another; precedence; higher estimation; predilection; choice; also, the power or opportunity of choosing; as, to give him his preference. | : (n.) That which is preferred; the object of choice or superior favor; as, which is your preference?
plumbiferous : (a.) Producing or containing lead.
pedunculate : (a.) Alt. of Pedunculated
phyllodineous : (a.) Having phyllodia; relating to phyllodia.
pilocarpine : (n.) An alkaloid extracted from jaborandi (Pilocarpus pennatifolius) as a white amorphous or crystalline substance which has a peculiar effect on the vasomotor system.
ponderer : (n.) One who ponders.
papyrus : (n.) A tall rushlike plant (Cyperus Papyrus) of the Sedge family, formerly growing in Egypt, and now found in Abyssinia, Syria, Sicily, etc. The stem is triangular and about an inch thick. | : (n.) The material upon which the ancient Egyptians wrote. It was formed by cutting the stem of the plant into thin longitudinal slices, which were gummed together and pressed. | : (n.) A manuscript written on papyrus; esp., pl., written scrolls made of papyrus; as, the papyri of Egypt or Herculaneum.
pharyngognathi : (n. pl.) A division of fishes in which the lower pharyngeal bones are united. It includes the scaroid, labroid, and embioticoid fishes.
parelle : (n.) A name for two kinds of dock (Rumex Patientia and R. Hydrolapathum). | : (n.) A kind of lichen (Lecanora parella) once used in dyeing and in the preparation of litmus.
phallic : (a.) Of or pertaining to the phallus, or to phallism.
precipitous : (a.) Steep, like a precipice; as, a precipitous cliff or mountain. | : (a.) Headlong; as, precipitous fall. | : (a.) Hasty; rash; quick; sudden; precipitate; as, precipitous attempts.
progging : (p. pr. & vb. n.) of Prog
pronominalize : (v. t.) To give the effect of a pronoun to; as, to pronominalize the substantives person, people, etc.
poetized : (imp. & p. p.) of Poetize
putchuck : (n.) Same as Pachak.
pondered : (imp. & p. p.) of Ponder
praetores : (n. pl.) A division of butterflies including the satyrs.
pectination : (n.) The state of being pectinated; that which is pectinated. | : (n.) The act of combing; the combing of the head. | : (n.) Comblike toothing.
propodium : (n.) The anterior portion of the foot of a mollusk. | : (n.) The segment which forms the posterior part of the thorax of a hymenopterous insect.
pedometric : (a.) Alt. of Pedometrical
poppet : (n.) See Puppet. | : (n.) One of certain upright timbers on the bilge ways, used to support a vessel in launching. | : (n.) An upright support or guide fastened at the bottom only.
puranic : (a.) Pertaining to the Puranas.
popper : (n.) A utensil for popping corn, usually a wire basket with a long handle. | : (n.) A dagger.
perennial : (a.) ing or continuing through the year; as, perennial fountains. | : (a.) Continuing without cessation or intermission; perpetual; unceasing; never failing. | : (a.) Continuing more than two years; as, a perennial steam, or root, or plant. | : (n.) A perennial plant; a plant which lives or continues more than two years, whether it retains its leaves in winter or not.
polypary : (n.) Same as Polypidom.
prevailingly : (adv.) So as to prevail.
prolixious : (a.) Dilatory; tedious; superfluous.
paravant : (adv.) Alt. of Paravant | : (adv.) In front; publicly. | : (adv.) Beforehand; first.
pericardic : (a.) Pericardiac.
proscript : (n.) A proscription; a prohibition; an interdict. | : (n.) One who is proscribed.
pauropoda : (n. pl.) An order of small myriapods having only nine pairs of legs and destitute of tracheae.
prakritic : (a.) Pertaining to Prakrit.
profaner : (n.) One who treats sacred things with irreverence, or defiles what is holy; one who uses profane language.
ptilopaedic : (a.) Having nearly the whole surface of the skin covered with down; dasypaedic; -- said of the young of certain birds.
perfectible : (a.) Capable of becoming, or being made, perfect.
perrier : (n.) A short mortar used formerly for throwing stone shot.
pseudo-bulb : (n.) An aerial corm, or thickened stem, as of some epiphytic orchidaceous plants.
poetize : (v. i.) To write as a poet; to compose verse; to idealize.
parforn : (v. t.) Alt. of Parfourn
precentor : (n.) A leader of a choir; a directing singer. | : (n.) The leader of the choir in a cathedral; -- called also the chanter or master of the choir. | : (n.) The leader of the congregational singing in Scottish and other churches.
preengaging : (p. pr. & vb. n.) of Preengage
propodite : (n.) The sixth joint of a typical leg of a crustacean; usually, the penultimate joint.
priggery : (n.) Priggism.
pynoun : (n.) A pennant.
palsywort : (n.) The cowslip (Primula veris); -- so called from its supposed remedial powers.
profaned : (imp. & p. p.) of Profane
primmed : (imp. & p. p.) of Prim
parigenin : (n.) A curdy white substance, obtained by the decomposition of parillin.
parental : (a.) Of or pertaining to a parent or to parents; as, parental authority; parental obligations. | : (a.) Becoming to, or characteristic of, parents; tender; affectionate; devoted; as, parental care.
pennyworth : (n.) A penny's worth; as much as may be bought for a penny. | : (n.) Hence: The full value of one's penny expended; due return for money laid out; a good bargain; a bargain. | : (n.) A small quantity; a trifle.
pedimanous : (a.) Having feet resembling hands, or with the first toe opposable, as the opossums and monkeys.
pink stern : ( ) See Chebacco, and 1st Pink.
precurrer : (n.) A precursor.
plenarily : (adv.) In a plenary manner.
parcel-mele : (adv.) By parcels or parts.
pentavalent : (a.) Having a valence of five; -- said of certain atoms and radicals.
polymastism : (n.) The condition of having more than two mammae, or breasts.
paragraphic : (a.) Alt. of Paragraphical
peerweet : (n.) Same as Pewit (a & b).
pledgery : (n.) A pledging; suretyship.
popped : (imp. & p. p.) of Pop
producement : (n.) Production.
palato- : ( ) A combining form used in anatomy to indicate relation to, or connection with, the palate; as in palatolingual.
polewards : (adv.) Toward a pole of the earth.
predication : (n.) The act of predicating, or of affirming one thing of another; affirmation; assertion. | : (n.) Preaching.
panic-struck : (a.) Struck with a panic, or sudden fear.
putting : (p. pr. & vb. n.) of Put | : (n.) The throwing of a heavy stone, shot, etc., with the hand raised or extended from the shoulder; -- originally, a Scottish game.
polytheistical : (a.) Of or pertaining to polytheism; characterized by polytheism; professing or advocating polytheism; as, polytheistic worship; a polytheistic author, or nation.
promise : (a.) In general, a declaration, written or verbal, made by one person to another, which binds the person who makes it to do, or to forbear to do, a specified act; a declaration which gives to the person to whom it is made a right to expect or to claim the performance or forbearance of a specified act. | : (a.) An engagement by one person to another, either in words or in writing, but properly not under seal, for the performance or nonperformance of some particular thing. The word promise is used to denote the mere engagement of a person, without regard to the consideration for it, or the corresponding duty of the party to whom it is made. | : (a.) That which causes hope, expectation, or assurance; especially, that which affords expectation of future distinction; as, a youth of great promise. | : (a.) Bestowal, fulfillment, or grant of what is promised. | : (v. t.) To engage to do, give, make, or to refrain from doing, giving, or making, or the like; to covenant; to engage; as, to promise a visit; to promise a cessation of hostilities; to promise the payment of money. | : (v. t.) To afford reason to expect; to cause hope or assurance of; as, the clouds promise rain. | : (v. t.) To make declaration of or give assurance of, as some benefit to be conferred; to pledge or engage to bestow; as, the proprietors promised large tracts of land; the city promised a reward. | : (v. i.) To give assurance by a promise, or binding declaration. | : (v. i.) To afford hopes or expectation; to give ground to expect good; rarely, to give reason to expect evil.
papally : (adv.) In a papal manner; popishly
parraqua : (n.) A curassow of the genus Ortalida, allied to the guan.
pupillometer : (n.) An instrument for measuring the size of the pupil of the pupil of the eye.
presentiment : (n.) Previous sentiment, conception, or opinion; previous apprehension; especially, an antecedent impression or conviction of something unpleasant, distressing, or calamitous, about to happen; anticipation of evil; foreboding.
paracelsist : (n.) A Paracelsian.
popple : (v. i.) To move quickly up and down; to bob up and down, as a cork on rough water; also, to bubble. | : (n.) The poplar. | : (n.) Tares.
presupposed : (imp. & p. p.) of Presuppose
prolification : (n.) The generation of young. | : (n.) Reproduction by the growth of a plant, or part of a plant, directly from an older one, or by gemmae.
pomiferous : (a.) Bearing pomes, or applelike fruits. | : (a.) Bearing fruits, or excrescences, more or less resembling an apple.
prostomia : (pl. ) of Prostomium
ptilosis : (n.) Same as Pterylosis.
peristerite : (n.) A variety of albite, whitish and slightly iridescent like a pigeon's neck.
pixie : (n.) An old English name for a fairy; an elf. | : (n.) A low creeping evergreen plant (Pyxidanthera barbulata), with mosslike leaves and little white blossoms, found in New Jersey and southward, where it flowers in earliest spring.
perpetrated : (imp. & p. p.) of Perpetrate
prerequisite : (a.) Previously required; necessary as a preliminary to any proposed effect or end; as, prerequisite conditions of success. | : (n.) Something previously required, or necessary to an end or effect proposed.
poignantly : (adv.) In a poignant manner.
pended : (imp. & p. p.) of Pend
polysepalous : (a.) Having the sepals separate from each other.
phagedenic : (a.) Alt. of PhagedenicAL
pappy : (a.) Like pap; soft; succulent; tender.
ponderal : (a.) Estimated or ascertained by weight; -- distinguished from numeral; as, a ponderal drachma.
probity : (n.) Tried virtue or integrity; approved moral excellence; honesty; rectitude; uprightness.
parthenogenitive : (a.) Parthenogenetic.
pinetum : (n.) A plantation of pine trees; esp., a collection of living pine trees made for ornamental or scientific purposes.
praefloration : (n.) Same as Prefloration.
personalities : (pl. ) of Personality
pleach : (v. t.) To unite by interweaving, as branches of trees; to plash; to interlock.
postposition : (n.) The act of placing after, or the state of being placed after. | : (n.) A word or particle placed after, or at the end of, another word; -- distinguished from preposition.
polypteroidei : (n. pl.) A suborder of existing ganoid fishes having numerous fins along the back. The bichir, or Polypterus, is the type. See Illust. under Crossopterygian.
pegging : (p. pr. & vb. n.) of Peg | : (n.) The act or process of fastening with pegs.
pilotage : (n.) The pilot's skill or knowledge, as of coasts, rocks, bars, and channels. | : (n.) The compensation made or allowed to a pilot. | : (n.) Guidance, as by a pilot.
pentadactyle : (a.) Having five digits to the hand or foot. | : (a.) Having five appendages resembling fingers or toes.
prelacy : (n.) The office or dignity of a prelate; church government by prelates. | : (n.) The order of prelates, taken collectively; the body of ecclesiastical dignitaries.
parella : (n.) Alt. of Parelle
preempt : (v. t. & i.) To settle upon (public land) with a right of preemption, as under the laws of the United States; to take by preemption.
plaided : (a.) Of the material of which plaids are made; tartan. | : (a.) Wearing a plaid.
polygamia : (n. pl.) A Linnaean class of plants, characterized by having both hermaphrodite and unisexual flowers on the same plant. | : (n. pl.) A name given by Linnaeus to file orders of plants having syngenesious flowers.
pelfish : (a.) Of or pertaining to pelf.
purrulence : (n.) Alt. of Purulency
patricidal : (a.) Of or pertaining to patricide; parricidal.
pulverization : (n.) The action of reducing to dust or powder.
poorhouse : (n.) A dwelling for a number of paupers maintained at public expense; an almshouse; a workhouse.
primulaceous : (a.) Of or pertaining to an order of herbaceous plants (Primulaceae), of which the primrose is the type, and the pimpernel, the cyclamen, and the water violet are other examples.
parturiency : (n.) Parturition.
particularized : (imp. & p. p.) of Particularize
papain : (n.) A proteolytic ferment, like trypsin, present in the juice of the green fruit of the papaw (Carica Papaya) of tropical America.
polyonomous : (a.) Having many names or titles; polyonymous.
pythagorism : (n.) The doctrines taught by Pythagoras.
paliform : (a.) Resembling a palus; as, the paliform lobes of the septa in corals.
pholades : (pl. ) of Pholas
plebiscite : (n.) A vote by universal male suffrage; especially, in France, a popular vote, as first sanctioned by the National Constitution of 1791.
pledgeor : (n.) Alt. of Pledgor
pharyngeal : (a.) Of or pertaining to the pharynx; in the region of the pharynx. | : (n.) A pharyngeal bone or cartilage; especially, one of the lower pharyngeals, which belong to the rudimentary fifth branchial arch in many fishes, or one of the upper pharyngeals, or pharyngobranchials, which are the dorsal elements in the complete branchial arches.
ptilopaedes : (n. pl.) Same as Dasypaedes.
premious : (a.) Rich in gifts.
periphrasing : (p. pr. & vb. n.) of Periphrase
pineries : (pl. ) of Pinery
president : (n.) Precedent. | : (a.) Occupying the first rank or chief place; having the highest authority; presiding. | : (n.) One who is elected or appointed to preside; a presiding officer, as of a legislative body. | : (n.) The chief officer of a corporation, company, institution, society, or the like. | : (n.) The chief executive officer of the government in certain republics; as, the president of the United States. | : (n.) A protector; a guardian; a presiding genius.
portglave : (n.) A sword bearer.
prophetess : (n.) A female prophet.
predicative : (a.) Expressing affirmation or predication; affirming; predicating, as, a predicative term.
pterygiums : (pl. ) of Pterygium
pinchfist : (n.) A closefisted person; a miser.
parturition : (n.) The act of bringing forth, or being delivered of, young; the act of giving birth; delivery; childbirth. | : (n.) That which is brought forth; a birth.
prejudging : (p. pr. & vb. n.) of Prejudge
proximo : ( ) In the next month after the present; -- often contracted to prox.; as, on the 3d proximo.
packfong : (n.) A Chinese alloy of nickel, zinc, and copper, resembling German silver.
prae- : ( ) A prefix. See Pre-.
prolicide : (n.) The crime of destroying one's offspring, either in the womb or after birth.
palewise : (adv.) In the manner of a pale or pales; by perpendicular lines or divisions; as, to divide an escutcheon palewise.
preexist : (v. i.) To exist previously; to exist before something else.
penury : (n.) Absence of resources; want; privation; indigence; extreme poverty; destitution. | : (n.) Penuriousness; miserliness.
predominance : (n.) The quality or state of being predominant; superiority; ascendency; prevalence; predomination. | : (n.) The superior influence of a planet.
papyrograph : (n.) An apparatus for multiplying writings, drawings, etc., in which a paper stencil, formed by writing or drawing with corrosive ink, is used. The word is also used of other means of multiplying copies of writings, drawings, etc. See Copygraph, Hectograph, Manifold.
purificator : (n.) One who, or that which, purifies; a purifier.
platonic : (a.) Alt. of Platonical | : (n.) A follower of Plato; a Platonist.
portableness : (n.) The quality or state of being portable; portability.
